finding: The SNP rs7128648 exhibited significant associations with impulsivity, linking it to various behavioral traits.
title: CADM2 is implicated in impulsive personality and numerous other traits by genome- and phenome-wide association studies in humans and mice

finding: The rs12252 C variant of the IFITM3 gene was associated with COVID-19. In the context of the study, this SNP was particularly relevant as it was linked to the immune response observed in individuals infected with the B.1.351 variant. The investigation underscored how genetic variants may influence immune transcriptome differences between vaccinated and unvaccinated individuals, particularly in older populations affected by COVID-19.
title: Impact of BNT162b first vaccination on the immune transcriptome of elderly patients infected with the B.1.351 SARS-CoV-2 variant

finding: The SNP rs2186797, corresponding to the missense variant ANO1:p.Phe608Ser, was identified as a causal variant with very high confidence (PP=97.0%). It was linked to gastrointestinal motility, specifically affecting the function of anoctamin-1, which is crucial for intestinal motility and peristalsis, highlighting its relevance to hemorrhoidal disease.
title: Genome-wide analysis of 944,133 individuals provides insights into the etiology of hemorrhoidal disease

finding: The SNP rs11604583 was identified as a novel variant near the TRIM51 gene, showing a protective effect with an odds ratio (OR) of 0.84 (95% CI: 0.79-0.89). This finding was replicated in the UK Biobank target cohort, resulting in an OR of 0.87 (95% CI: 0.8-0.95), indicating its significant association with reduced risk of Deep Vein Thrombosis (DVT).
title: Using genotyping and whole-exome sequencing data to improve genetic risk prediction in deep venous thrombosis

finding: The SNP rs187725533 was recognized as a novel rare variant near the CREB3L1 gene, associated with a 2.2-fold increased risk of DVT (OR: 2.47; 95% CI: 2-3.06). This missense variant was highlighted for its significant prevalence in DVT cases, having been found in 112 cases.
title: Using genotyping and whole-exome sequencing data to improve genetic risk prediction in deep venous thrombosis

finding: The SNP rs1799963, found at the F2 locus, was recognized for its strong association with DVT with an odds ratio (OR) of 2.16 (95% CI: 1.85-2.52) and is correlated with the prothrombin G20210A mutation (PTM). This finding classified it as a well-known risk factor for DVT.
title: Using genotyping and whole-exome sequencing data to improve genetic risk prediction in deep venous thrombosis

finding: The SNP rs612611 located at 11q13.3 exhibited an association with a decreased risk of multiple cancers (OR=0.90, P=2.3×10^-8), indicating its role as a potential protective factor.
title: Unraveling the genetic landscape of susceptibility to multiple primary cancers

finding: This SNP was a protein-altering variant in the ANO5 gene, suggested to be causal for adult-onset muscular dystrophy.
title: Using human genetics to understand the causes and consequences of circulating cardiac troponin I in the general population

finding: The SNP rs75356043 was associated with the hemoglobin gene cluster on chromosome 11 and reported to have a posterior probability of causality of 0.70, indicating it may also have had a role in influencing fetal hemoglobin levels.
title: Genomic discovery and functional validation of MRP1 as a novel fetal hemoglobin modulator and potential therapeutic target in sickle cell disease

finding: The rs45550635 variant, a rare missense variant in the CSRP3 gene, was found to be associated with increased strain and left ventricular ejection fraction. CSRP3 is a cardiomyopathy-associated gene primarily linked with hypertrophic cardiomyopathy (HCM) and this association had not been reported in previous genome-wide association studies (GWAS).
title: Genetic architecture of cardiac structure and function

finding: SNP rs73404549 on chromosome 11 achieved genome-wide significance in the MetaNONRES (p=5.6×10^-11) and MetaALL (p=7.7×10^-13) analyses. It was situated near genes HBE1, OR51B4, and HBB, predominantly driven by West African ancestry datasets, and showed linkage disequilibrium with the sickle cell trait SNP rs334.
title: Genetic Association and Transferability for Urinary Albumin-Creatinine Ratio as a Marker of Kidney Disease in four Sub-Saharan African Populations and non-continental Individuals of African Ancestry

finding: The SNP rs770030288 was identified as a deleterious coding variant located in the C2 domain of the MYBPC3 protein. It resulted in an arginine to histidine substitution at position 419, which impaired the interaction stability with the ACTC1 protein. This finding underscored the SNP's significance in the context of protein stability and its potential contribution to congenital heart disease (CHD).
title: Computational analysis of congenital heart disease associated SNPs: Unveiling their impact on the gene regulatory system

finding: Located on chromosome 11q13.1, rs174592 was connected with multiple conditions including bipolar disorder, cholesterol, and psychiatric risk, and was noted as significant in the context of mania.
title: Isolating the genetic component of mania in bipolar disorder

finding: Individuals with the GALNT18 rs4910008 CC genotype showed an increased response to tocilizumab as compared to those with CT and TT genotypes, marking it as a favorable genetic variant for therapeutic effectiveness.
title: Interleukin-6 receptor genetic variation and tocilizumab treatment response to COVID-19

finding: A mild positive association with late evening stroke occurrences was noted for the 'CC' genotype of rs2292912 in the CRY2 gene, with an odds ratio of 1.738 and a p-value of 0.0488, suggesting it may influence circadian patterns of stroke onset.
title: Clinical implication of time of stroke among post stroke survivors from eastern India: A circadian perspective

finding: SNP rs10840273 was associated with leg BMD, with a significant P-value of 4.52×10^-9, and showed a significant association with gene expression of SWAP70, as supported by whole blood eQTL data.
title: GWAS of ∼30,000 samples with bone mineral density at multiple skeletal sites and its clinical relevance on fracture prediction, genetic correlations and prioritization of drug targets

finding: This SNP was implicated in the shared genetic architecture of head BMD and IA, supporting the hypothesis of polygenic influences on both traits.
title: GWAS of ∼30,000 samples with bone mineral density at multiple skeletal sites and its clinical relevance on fracture prediction, genetic correlations and prioritization of drug targets

finding: The SNP rs7925543 at the YAP1 locus was also identified in fine-mapping analyses, although specific associations with PCOS features were not detailed, highlighting its importance in ongoing research into the genetic contributions to the syndrome.
title: Genomic and proteomic evidence for hormonal and metabolic foundations of polycystic ovary syndrome

finding: The SNP rs415895 in SWAP70 was associated with a C to G base change leading to a Q to E amino acid change, which resulted in reduced expression of SWAP70 in PBMCs. This SNP also demonstrated strong association (p = 1.08×10^-9) with expression levels of SWAP70, highlighting its significance in the study's findings regarding hypertension.
title: Dual site proteomic analyses reveal potential drug targets for cardiovascular disease

finding: Located in ODF3 at 11p15.5, rs7103852 was associated with PSA levels, highlighting its potential implications in prostate cancer diagnostics and further research.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: The variant rs10466455 was associated with PSA levels, reinforcing the study's findings regarding genetic influences on prostate cancer risk.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: With a risk difference (RD) of 0.16, rs34451549 was associated with beta thalassemia and demonstrated large effects in younger populations (ages 20-30).
title: Deleterious Variants Contribute Minimal Excess Risk in Large-Scale Testing

finding: The SNP rs12279250 in the NELL1 gene had clinically significant odds ratios (OR ≥ 2.5) and was statistically significant with a p-value of less than 0.001 in simple logistic regression analysis. This indicated a dominant genotypic effect related to high LDL-C levels.
title: Variant rs9644568 in the intergenic region downstream of the LPL gene is associated with high LDL cholesterol levels among Filipinos

finding: The rs661946 SNP was found to be perfectly correlated with mPAS staining in all samples evaluated, indicating its role as an essential regulator of NXPE1 expression and sialic acid O-acetylation in colon tissue. This SNP, located 6 base pairs upstream of the NXPE1 transcriptional start site, influenced protein levels significantly, as heterozygous individuals (C/T) displayed no NXPE1 protein expression in mPAS positive crypts and robust staining in adjacent cells.
title: NXPE1 alters the sialoglycome by acetylating sialic acids in the human colon

finding: The BP allele of rs2270448 was associated with decreased expression of SF3B2 in the brain cerebellum (P = 1.28×10−5), providing insights into splicing regulation.
title: Pathway-based polygenic score analysis identifies the NRF2-KEAP1 and mRNA splicing - minor pathways as enriched in shared genetic variation between chronotype and bipolar disorder

finding: The SNP was associated with the addiction risk factor (addiction-rf), being the most significant SNP (p=2.9e-12) mapping intergenically near DRD2, which was significant in gene-based analyses (p=7.9e-12) and was identified as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for DRD2 in the cerebellum.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association meta-analysis of over 1 million subjects identifies loci underlying multiple substance use disorders

finding: The SNP rs1846476 marked an ASD-SV present in 22% of cases, potentially disrupting a FOXA1 binding site critical for GRM5 expression. This disruption connects it with glutamate signaling pathways, which are essential for proper brain development.
title: Structural Variants Are a Major Component of the Missing Heritability of Autism Spectrum Disorder

finding: The rs3740688 variant in the SPI1 gene was previously linked to cognitive traits and was associated with longevity.
title: The effect of Alzheimer’s disease-associated genetic variants on longevity

finding: The SNP rs10896045 was categorized as G1-specific, underscoring its involvement in the transition of IgG glycosylation states which is linked to galactosylation.
title: Mapping of the gene network that regulates glycan clock of ageing

finding: The SNP rs1566734 within the PTPRJ gene was identified as a non-synonymous single nucleotide variant (SNV) at position 44,260,501 on chromosome 17, resulting in an amino acid change from Q276P. This mutation was associated with carcinoma of the colon.
title: A newly identified pathology of Episodic Angioedema with Hypereosinophilia (Gleich’s Syndrome) revealed by Multi-Omics Analysis

finding: The sentinel variant rs174592, located at the FADS1/2/3 gene cluster, was identified as being associated with a higher risk of bipolar disorder (BPD) and was correlated with lower levels of plasma arachidonic acid (ARA). This finding was consistent with the results observed in metabolome-wide Mendelian randomization analyses.
title: A metabolome-wide Mendelian randomization study identifies dysregulated arachidonic acid synthesis as a potential causal risk factor for bipolar disorder

finding: The sentinel variant rs174556 at the FADS1/2/3 cluster was found to be associated with higher levels of arachidonic acid (ARA) in breast milk, with a significant effect size indicating a 17% increase per major allele. This suggested that genetic variation at this locus could influence ARA levels, which may modulate BPD risk, demonstrating the overlap in genetic signal between breast milk composition and BPD.
title: A metabolome-wide Mendelian randomization study identifies dysregulated arachidonic acid synthesis as a potential causal risk factor for bipolar disorder

finding: Prioritized for its gene CD5, this SNP showed a specific association with male reproductive traits, such as prostate cancer, while also linking to thyroid function.
title: Uncovering the Shared Genetic Components of Thyroid Disorders and Reproductive Health

finding: Linking to reproductive health traits, this SNP further validated the connections between thyroid function and reproductive health in both sexes.
title: Uncovering the Shared Genetic Components of Thyroid Disorders and Reproductive Health

finding: This SNP was included among those linking thyroid and reproductive health, reinforcing the genetic interrelationships of these traits.
title: Uncovering the Shared Genetic Components of Thyroid Disorders and Reproductive Health

finding: The rs772677709 variant in the SORL1 gene, which leads to a p.Y1816C substitution, was demonstrated to have a causal relationship with early-onset Alzheimer's Disease (AD) through segregation analysis in three unrelated families. This variant was inherited by three patients diagnosed with early-onset AD, who had a familial history of the disease, with ages of onset ranging from 50 to 69 years. Functional assays indicated that the p.Y1816C variant impaired SORLA dimerization and trafficking, which reduced the shedding of the soluble SORLA fragment (sSORLA). Additionally, iPSC-derived neurons with this mutation exhibited enlarged endosomes, which is characteristic of AD pathology. Overall, these results provided strong evidence supporting the pathogenicity of the rs772677709 variant, indicating it should be included in clinical genetic screening for early-onset AD.
title: The SORL1 p.Y1816C variant causes impaired endosomal dimerization and autosomal dominant Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The MUC5B rs35705950 genetic variant was significantly associated with the RA-UIP subtype of RA-ILD, mirroring findings in IPF. Specifically, the risk allele for this SNP was noted to promote a UIP pattern of lung injury in individuals with rheumatoid arthritis.
title: Rheumatoid arthritis and idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis: a bidirectional Mendelian randomisation study

finding: The rs10898815 variant in the NUMA1 gene increased the likelihood of patients switching antihypertensive medication with a hazard ratio of 1.16 (95% CI 1.07 to 1.27, p=0.0009). This suggests that the presence of this variant was significant in influencing treatment changes in patients prescribed dCCB.
title: Calcium Channel Blockers: clinical outcome associations with reported pharmacogenetics variants in 32,000 patients

finding: The rs1892971 variant was near the MMP13 gene, encoding matrix metalloproteinase 13, influencing collagen structurally in atherosclerotic plaques.
title: Discovery and systematic characterization of risk variants and genes for coronary artery disease in over a million participants

finding: SLC22A18 SNP (rs450208) was associated with T2D in males, showing dominance of genetic factors in male diagnosis groups.
title: Sex-specific genetic loci linked to early and late onset type 2 diabetes

finding: The KCNQ1 SNP (rs2237897) had a stronger association with T2D in males than in females, confirming the variable genetic influences by sex and age.
title: Sex-specific genetic loci linked to early and late onset type 2 diabetes

finding: The study established that the genotype at rs174535, located in the FADS1/FADS2 genes, was significantly associated with the abundances of two ASCVD-related plasmalogens, specifically 1-(1-enyl-palmitoyl)-2-arachidonoyl-GPC and 1-(1-enyl-stearoyl)-2-arachidonoyl-GPE. An increase in the G allele at this SNP was associated with a greater risk of ASCVD. This finding indicated a novel link between FADS1/FADS2-related SNPs and ASCVD outcomes.
title: Mid-Life Plasmalogens and Other Metabolites with Anti-Inflammatory Properties are Inversely Associated with Long term Cardiovascular Disease Events: Heart SCORE Study

finding: The SNP rs174547 was in near-perfect linkage equilibrium with rs174535, and though not statistically significant for ASCVD events, it was associated with an increased risk of aortic stenosis and coronary artery disease in European and Chinese populations, respectively. This relationship suggested potential interaction with plasmalogen levels in mediating ASCVD risk.
title: Mid-Life Plasmalogens and Other Metabolites with Anti-Inflammatory Properties are Inversely Associated with Long term Cardiovascular Disease Events: Heart SCORE Study

finding: Like rs174547, rs174546 exhibited a strong linkage disequilibrium with rs174535. It was previously associated with increased risk for coronary artery disease and ischemic stroke in Chinese populations. The minor T allele of this SNP was noted in connection with lower FADS1 mRNA levels in human liver, implicating a connection to lipid level regulation and ASCVD.
title: Mid-Life Plasmalogens and Other Metabolites with Anti-Inflammatory Properties are Inversely Associated with Long term Cardiovascular Disease Events: Heart SCORE Study

finding: SNP rs7941686 in TYR was associated with the ease of skin tanning phenotype, significantly differing in effect between European and other non-African ancestries.
title: Inter-population differences of allele frequency and regulome tagging are associated with the heterogeneity of loci identified by cross-ancestry genome-wide association studies

finding: The top variant rs2051466 was found to be significantly associated with circulating 3BH5C levels, showing a Beta (SE) of 0.50 (0.04) and a P-value of 7.9×10−43. This association was confirmed in replication studies using data from METSIM and CLSA cohorts.
title: Metabolome-wide association of carotid intima media thickness identifies FDX1 as a determinant of cholesterol metabolism and cardiovascular risk in Asian populations

finding: rs10488763 was identified as a potentially causal variant affecting plasma 3BH5C concentrations and was also associated with an increased risk of Coronary Artery Disease (CAD) in the Japanese population and in trans-ethnic meta-analyses. It displayed strong linkage disequilibrium with rs1443120 and had evidence for association specifically with cardiovascular traits.
title: Metabolome-wide association of carotid intima media thickness identifies FDX1 as a determinant of cholesterol metabolism and cardiovascular risk in Asian populations

finding: Similar to rs10488763, rs1443120 showed a significant association with 3BH5C and CAD. It was noted for being in strong linkage disequilibrium with rs10488763, with comparable effects on both 3BH5C concentration and CAD risk, though it was not significantly associated with CAD in predominantly European populations.
title: Metabolome-wide association of carotid intima media thickness identifies FDX1 as a determinant of cholesterol metabolism and cardiovascular risk in Asian populations

finding: rs2846734 was associated significantly with the expression of FDX1, a gene linked to 3BH5C metabolism. The association was validated through the summary-based MR method, displaying a P-value of 8.5×10−10, indicating its role as a cis-eQTL for FDX1.
title: Metabolome-wide association of carotid intima media thickness identifies FDX1 as a determinant of cholesterol metabolism and cardiovascular risk in Asian populations

finding: As part of the evaluation of vitamin D metabolism genes, rs2276360 additionally confirmed the protective role of 25(OH)D against MSA, consistent with the results obtained using other SNPs.
title: Relationships between 25-Hydroxyvitamin D and Alpha-synucleinopathies: A Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: The SNP rs36037728 was among those that validated the protective association of 25(OH)D with MSA in the conducted analyses.
title: Relationships between 25-Hydroxyvitamin D and Alpha-synucleinopathies: A Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: This SNP was linked to anxiety disorders and was part of the subset of variants exhibiting strong pleiotropic associations with hematological and cardiometabolic outcomes.
title: Genome-wide association study of major anxiety disorders in 122,341 European-ancestry cases identifies 58 loci and highlights GABAergic signaling

finding: SNP rs79336999 within the PATL1 gene was also found to be significantly associated with ischemic stroke, particularly in African American individuals.
title: Exome Array Analysis of 9,721 ischemic stroke cases from the SiGN Consortium

finding: The SNP rs5744249 was identified as a cis-pQTL that had a significant association with lower IL-18 protein levels, which correlated with a reduced risk of lung adenocarcinoma, as indicated by an odds ratio (OR) of 0.80. This association reflected a protective effect of elevated IL-18 derived from genetically predicted plasma levels.
title: IL-18 and Lower Risk for Lung Cancer: Triangulated Evidence from Germline Predictions, Pre-Diagnostic Measurements, and Tumor Expression

finding: The SNP rs1135071 was noted for its significant impact on hemoglobin levels in blood donors. It was linked to the Hb Tacoma variant and correlated negatively with hemoglobin assembly, thus gaining acknowledgment as a positive finding.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals the unique genetic structure of active blood donors

finding: The rs1800497 SNP, known as the TaqIA SNP located in the coding region of ANKK1, was associated with traits related to alcoholism, schizophrenia, and eating disorders, indicating its potential role in neuropsychiatric disorders. However, since the expression of the gene DRD2, which is in the same region, was not tested due to lack of sufficient signal, it was unclear whether the effect of rs1800497 was mediated through DRD2 or ANKK1.
title: Local genetic correlations exist among neurodegenerative and neuropsychiatric diseases

finding: The SNP rs661348 was identified with a suggestive association with intracerebral hemorrhagic stroke, showing an odds ratio (OR) of 1.3 (95% CI [1.2, 1.4], p value 8.0×10^-8) in the study. Although not previously recognized as a stroke-associated variant, it was linked to two common non-coding variants (rs569550 and rs1973765) that had prior associations with stroke. Conditional analysis suggested rs661348 represents the same stroke risk locus as these variants. Additionally, a nominal association with hypertension was observed (OR 1.0, 95% CI [1.0, 1.1], p value 2.61×10^-2) in the Pakistani cohort.
title: NOTCH3 p.Arg1231Cys is Markedly Enriched in South Asians and Associated with Stroke

finding: In the context of CCB treatment, the A allele of NUMA1 rs10898815 was positively associated with an increased risk of treatment discontinuation, with a hazard ratio of 1.07 (95% CI 1.02-1.12) overall. This risk increased significantly in patients with high polygenic scores for fat mass and lean mass, indicating a compound genetic influence on outcome.
title: Combining pharmacogenetics and patient characteristic polygenic scores to improve outcome prediction for Calcium Channel Blocker treatment

finding: The SNP rs150090666 in the PDE3B gene was similarly linked to lower WHR<sub>adjBMI</sub> through loss-of-function variants, highlighting its involvement in the regulation of body fat distribution.
title: Identification of rare loss of function variation regulating body fat distribution

finding: The SNP rs145502455 in PLCB3 was found to be significantly associated with WHR<sub>adjBMI</sub> in women, demonstrating a gender-specific effect on fat distribution.
title: Identification of rare loss of function variation regulating body fat distribution

finding: This SNP was implicated with the genes FADS1 and FADS2; however, it was identified only when self-reported data were excluded from the meta-analysis, confirming its previous identification as a BD locus.
title: Genomics yields biological and phenotypic insights into bipolar disorder

finding: The variant rs200831171 was characterized as a splice donor 5th base variant in the APOA5 gene. It was found to be associated with higher triglyceride (TG) concentrations, exhibiting the largest effect size among six coding variants in APOA5 associated with TG levels. It had a Delta Score indicating high donor loss potential, and a significant association was reported with a beta coefficient of 1.10 and a p-value of 7.0 x 10^-4.
title: Exome wide association study for blood lipids in 1,158,017 individuals from diverse populations

finding: The SNP rs76950800 was associated with RBS-R restricted (p = 2.4 × 10−7) and was located within E2F8, a transcription factor that regulates SNRPN, which is linked with several neurodevelopmental conditions including autism.
title: Clinical autism subscales have common genetic liability that is heritable, pleiotropic, and generalizable to the general population

finding: The minor C-allele of SNP rs12364973 was correlated with increased IFITM1 gene expression in SS patients. This result demonstrated a significant genetic regulation of gene expression related to SS.
title: An integrative multi-omics approach in Sjögren’s Syndrome identifies novel genetic drivers with regulatory function and disease-specificity

finding: The allele of rs766826 was associated with a >4-fold higher risk for severe COVID-19 (odds ratio: 4.85; p-value<3.1×10^-7), particularly influencing ELF5 expression in the lung. Colocalisation studies indicated a high probability (PP=99%) that rs766826 was the causal variant at the ELF5 locus for severe COVID-19 outcomes.
title: ELF5 is a respiratory epithelial cell-specific risk gene for severe COVID-19

finding: The SNP rs2344609 showed a significant association with the expression of the CNGA4 gene and was identified in a cross-trait meta-analysis as related to both endometriosis and IBS. This suggests a shared genetic risk that may link both diseases.
title: Evidence of shared genetic factors in the aetiology of gastrointestinal disorders and endometriosis and clinical implications for disease management

finding: The variant apoA-V Q252X (rs149808404) was characterized as a very rare naturally occurring genetic variant associated with elevated plasma triglyceride (TG) levels. This SNP was identified in the Penn Medicine Biobank and was linked to the elimination of a C-terminal hydrophobic region in apoA-V, consistent with loss of function. Carriers of this variant showed significantly elevated plasma TG levels compared to matched non-carrier controls, as well as increased TG to apoB ratios, indicating its effect on lipolysis. The Q252X variant was shown to maintain functionality in reducing plasma TG in vivo despite its truncation.
title: Comparison of the structure-function properties of wild-type human apoA-V and a C-terminal truncation associated with elevated plasma triglycerides

finding: The variant apoA-V G162C (rs2075291) was identified as a known rare loss-of-function variant associated with elevated plasma triglyceride levels. Carriers of this variant, compared to matched non-carriers, exhibited significantly increased plasma TG levels and increased TG to apoB ratios, thereby confirming its impact on lipolysis of triglyceride-rich lipoproteins. This SNP served as a positive control in the study, further supporting the functional implications of genetic variants in the APOA5 gene.
title: Comparison of the structure-function properties of wild-type human apoA-V and a C-terminal truncation associated with elevated plasma triglycerides

finding: The SNP rs174564, located near the FADS1-2-3 genes, was significantly associated with the levels of phosphatidylcholine (PC(36:4)). This association was quantified with a beta value of -0.62 and a p-value of 8.1x10^-72, indicating a robust relationship between this genetic variant and lipid metabolism alterations observed in pediatric NAFLD, mimicking changes linked to cardiometabolic disease in adults.
title: Plasma lipidomics identifies a signature of NAFLD in children that couples with cardiometabolic outcomes in adults

finding: The SNP rs12275055 was identified within a novel credible set and was reported to have pleiotropic associations with multiple cancer types. It acted as an eQTL in various tissues for TPCN2, which is involved in processes related to cancer cell autophagy.
title: A novel Bayesian fine-mapping model using a continuous global-local shrinkage prior with applications in prostate cancer analysis

finding: The SNP rs3212870 was detected within the context of credible sets that included CCND1. Its intronic location and association with prostate cancer were previously unreported, attributed to weak marginal associations, highlighting its potential role.
title: A novel Bayesian fine-mapping model using a continuous global-local shrinkage prior with applications in prostate cancer analysis

finding: The SNP rs174575 was identified as the leading SNP in the most significant locus associated with MetaboAgeMort, which pertained to the genes FADS1 and FADS2 on chromosome 11. This finding indicated a strong genetic link to metabolomic aging, thereby highlighting its relevance in understanding diverse aging rates across individuals.
title: Heterogeneous metabolomic aging across the same age and prediction of health outcome

finding: The SNP rs779406084, identified in the PICALM gene, emerged as the most strongly associated variant with HMSE score, marking it as a significant finding in the South Asian cohort. This rare missense variant exhibited a higher minor allele frequency in LASI-DAD compared to European Ancestry populations, and its high CADD score placed it in the top 0.2 percentile of deleterious SNVs, suggesting potential implications for cognitive function.
title: Region-based analysis with functional annotation identifies genes associated with cognitive function in South Asians from India

finding: Variant rs12799883 was linked to both the risk of prostate cancer and the expression level of CCND1e (CCND1 eRNA), an important factor in prostate cancer progression.
title: Enhancer RNA transcriptome-wide association study reveals an atlas of pan-cancer susceptibility eRNAs

finding: Variant rs1712829 exhibited association with both p.H1047R alterations and any PIK3CA mutation, indicating its relevance in the genetic landscape of breast cancer.
title: Association of ESR1 germline variants with TP53 somatic variants in breast tumors in a genome-wide study

finding: This variant showed association with PIK3CA H1047R/L mutations in the AFA population with P values of 0.022.
title: Association of ESR1 germline variants with TP53 somatic variants in breast tumors in a genome-wide study

finding: In the study, rs11042158 was associated with lower cerebellar volume. The C allele of this common variant showed a significant association with reduced cerebellar volume in the UK Biobank sample, with a reported beta of -517.30. This association likely indicated a mechanism involving lower expression of the SCUBE2 gene in the cerebellum, as demonstrated by GTEx v8 data, where the C allele was linked to decreased expression of SCUBE2. The statistical significance of the association was highlighted by a p-value of 6.94×10^-13.
title: Rare variant aggregation highlights rare disease genes associated with brain volume variation

finding: The SNP rs4071559 was one of the lead SNPs at the MLLT10 locus, which showed significant overlaps (11 biofeatures). It was associated with endometriosis risk and had supporting evidence indicating altered expression of nearby genes in primary EOC tissues, underscoring its relevance in the pathological overlap between endometriosis and EOC.
title: A multi-level investigation of the genetic relationship between endometriosis and ovarian cancer histotypes

finding: SNP rs11031005 demonstrated significant associations with endometriosis, high-grade serous ovarian cancer, and low-grade serous ovarian cancer. It was in LD with variants that regulate FSHB gene transcription, linking it to reproductive traits and diseases.
title: A multi-level investigation of the genetic relationship between endometriosis and ovarian cancer histotypes

finding: The SNP rs10835638, part of the FSHB locus, was noted for its involvement in regulating FSHB gene transcription and was significantly associated with multiple reproductive traits and conditions.
title: A multi-level investigation of the genetic relationship between endometriosis and ovarian cancer histotypes

finding: SNP rs11031006 was identified as an enhancer polymorphism involved in regulating the transcription of the FSHB gene, thus highlighting its potential role in the genetic architecture linking endometriosis and EOC.
title: A multi-level investigation of the genetic relationship between endometriosis and ovarian cancer histotypes

finding: The SNP rs2078267 in the SLC22A11 gene also demonstrated an association with increased risk of insulin resistance (IR). Those carrying the T/T genotype were found to have an odds ratio of 3.72, with a 95% confidence interval from 1.22 to 11.28 (p < 0.0091), based on a recessive model.
title: Genetic Polymorphisms Associated with Insulin Resistance Risk in Normal BMI Indians

finding: The SNP rs1076560 in the DRD2 gene was found to be associated with personality traits and anxiety in individuals with polysubstance use disorder. This finding highlighted the role of the dopaminergic system in behavioral traits linked to addiction and related disorders.
title: The pleiotropic contribution of genes in dopaminergic and serotonergic pathways to addiction, aggression, and related behavioural traits

finding: The rs35705950 SNP between MUC5AC and MUC5B was significantly associated with reduced lifespan in males (β = 0.01, p = 2.1 × 10^-8). It was linked to increased MUC5B expression in lung tissue and had associations with pulmonary fibrosis, making it an important finding.
title: Genetic associations with human longevity are enriched for oncogenic genes

finding: The rs587779834 SNP in the ATM gene was associated with reduced lifespan, cited with a p-value of 2.7 × 10^-5, demonstrating the relevance of this gene in longevity studies.
title: Genetic associations with human longevity are enriched for oncogenic genes

finding: The study identified a significant association between the Taq1A genotype (rs1800497) and performance on a working memory task in participants with obesity. Those carrying the genotype related to lower dopamine receptor density in the striatum showed poorer task performance, indicating a link between this genetic variant and obesity-related cognitive deficits.
title: Working Memory Gating in Obesity: Insights from a Case-Control fMRI Study

finding: This SNP in DRD2 was linked to TUD, highlighting its relationship with dopaminergic transmission and nicotine dependence.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of tobacco use disorders based on electronic health record data prioritizes novel candidate risk genes and reveals associations with numerous health outcomes

finding: This SNP in NCAM1 was found to influence smoking-related traits through its modulation of dopamine signaling.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of tobacco use disorders based on electronic health record data prioritizes novel candidate risk genes and reveals associations with numerous health outcomes

finding: Associated with TUD, this SNP in BDNF roles in synaptogenesis and memory was supported as relevant for substance use disorders.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of tobacco use disorders based on electronic health record data prioritizes novel candidate risk genes and reveals associations with numerous health outcomes

finding: The SNP rs948445, associated with ACY3, showed a more restricted set of associations with four specific N-acetylated aromatic amino acids, emphasizing its role in specific metabolite interactions.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: The SNP rs7940113 in CHKA was positively linked to choline phosphate, indicating its metabolic relevance.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: The SNP rs2724417 related to FDX1 was correlated with 3beta-hydroxy-5-cholestenoate, indicating its role in cholesterol metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: SNP rs7128649 exhibited a significant association (p=2.50E-09) with impulsivity, confirming its potential role in this phenotype.
title: CADM2 is implicated in impulsive personality and numerous other traits by genome- and phenome-wide association studies in humans, with further support from studies of Cadm2 mutant mice

finding: The SNP rs73392700 was associated with rIA, achieving genome-wide significance with a p-value of 4.84×10^−17 and an odds ratio of 1.12. This SNP was part of the analysis across 24 published GWAS studies, confirming its association with rIA.
title: Integrative genomics analysis implicates decreased FGD6 expression underlying risk of intracranial aneurysm rupture

finding: The polymorphism rs35705950 in the MUC5B gene was found to confer protective effects against COVID-19 hospitalization, although not significantly against severe disease.
title: Potential associations of selected polymorphic genetic variants with COVID-19 disease susceptibility and severity

finding: The SNP rs10890563 was associated with gestational diabetes and showed an odds ratio (OR) of 1.88 with a P-value of 3.53×10^-8. This variant is a 3' UTR variant on the GUCY1A2 gene, which is involved in the regulation of insulin signaling.
title: Genetic Polymorphisms Associated with Adverse Pregnancy Outcomes in Nulliparas

finding: The SNP rs10830963 in the MTNR1B gene, known to play a significant role in glucose metabolism, showed a strong association with glucose levels. In the meta-analysis, it reached a p-value of 1.5 × 10^-60 but was not replicated in the UK Biobank, where it exhibited a p-value of 0.60, likely due to differences in fasting status among samples.
title: Genome-wide characterization of circulating metabolic biomarkers reveals substantial pleiotropy and novel disease pathways

finding: The TRIM5 variant rs11601507 was associated with 42 lipoprotein and lipid traits and demonstrated metabolic effects similar to those induced by statin therapy. This association highlights the potential for TRIM5 to influence lipid levels and contribute to coronary artery disease risk.
title: Genome-wide characterization of circulating metabolic biomarkers reveals substantial pleiotropy and novel disease pathways

finding: The SNP rs174564 near FADS1/FADS2 showed a strong association with polyunsaturated fatty acids, confirming its role in lipid pathways and potential relevance in broader lipidomic and metabolic studies.
title: Lipo-proteomic and metabolic fine-mapping of genetic lipid risk loci

finding: The rs4757137 SNP in the promoter region of the BMAL1 gene was associated with increased difficulty awakening after conditioning on chronotype, with a beta conditional of 0.012 (p = 2.02×10^{-10}). It was also associated with morning chronotype after conditioning on difficulty awakening, showing a beta conditional of -0.05 (p = 1.10×10^{-12}). Although the marginal effect on difficulty awakening was not significant (beta marginal = 0.003, p = 0.05), the significant marginal effect on chronotype (beta marginal = -0.04, p = 4.96×10^{-9}) indicated its relevance to circadian rhythms.
title: Sleep inertia drives the association of evening chronotype with psychiatric disorders: epidemiological and genetic evidence

finding: This variant was noted as an eQTL in the FADS2 gene, identifying it as an EUR-specific signal linked to RA risk.
title: Trans-ancestry genome-wide association study identifies novel genetic mechanisms in rheumatoid arthritis

finding: The SNP rs1582763 in the MS4A4A locus was positively associated with higher plasma TREM2 levels. This SNP has been previously correlated with lower Alzheimer's disease risk and higher CSF TREM2 levels.
title: Genome and epigenome wide studies of plasma protein biomarkers for Alzheimer’s disease implicate TBCA and TREM2 in disease risk

finding: At the rs11217020 locus associated with DDX6, significant interactions with enhancer regions were found, linking this SNP to multiple potential candidate genes including CXCR5, UPK2, and IFT46/ARCN1 in CD4+ T cells. The expression of CXCR5 was significantly higher in CD4+ T cells (log2FC = 3.21, FDR = 1.05 × 10^-09).
title: Functional genomics in primary T cells and monocytes identifies mechanisms by which genetic susceptibility loci influence systemic sclerosis risk

finding: The SNP rs187115 in the CD44 gene was identified as a predictive biomarker for selecting patients who were likely to benefit from pancreatic resection, indicating its association with tumor-related death in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC) patients.
title: Prospective validation of a predictive non-invasive SNP-based biomarker signature in resectable pancreatic cancer: a study protocol

finding: The SNP rs353630 in the CD44 gene was found to associate with an over 2-fold increased risk for tumor-related death across two independent PDAC study cohorts, thereby supporting its role as a predictive biomarker for survival after pancreatic resection.
title: Prospective validation of a predictive non-invasive SNP-based biomarker signature in resectable pancreatic cancer: a study protocol

finding: The SNP rs10835187 was identified at a genome-wide significance level (P = 1.11 × 10^-13) as an intergenic variant between the genes LGR4-AS1 and LIN7C. It was associated with both bone density and brain volume measurements, suggesting its relevance in structural brain aging. Notably, previous studies linked allelic and haplotypic variations in the LIN7C gene with ADHD, indicating the potential importance of this SNP in neuropsychiatric contexts.
title: Population clustering of structural brain aging and its association with brain development

finding: The SNP rs76289836 at 11q13.4 was significantly associated with cortical thickness (CT) in the right banks of superior temporal sulcus (STS), presenting the strongest association with a p-value of 6.4×10^-20. This finding was linked to the nearest gene IGF2, which has previously been implicated in anxiety and PTSD.
title: Common and Disorders-Specific Cortical Thickness Alterations in Internalizing, Externalizing and Thought Disorders over a 2-year Period in the Preadolescents of the ABCD Study

finding: The study revealed that the promoter variant TYR c.-301C>T [rs4547091] modulated the penetrance of a prevalent disease-associated missense change TYR c.1205G>A [rs1126809], significantly influencing the expression of the TYR gene and its association with albinism. Specifically, the reference allele reduced gene expression, thus playing a critical role in the phenotype.
title: The contribution of common regulatory and protein-coding TYR variants in the genetic architecture of albinism

finding: The finding indicated that the missense variant TYR c.1205G>A [rs1126809], identified as affecting skin/hair pigmentation and potentially causing a mild form of albinism when in compound heterozygous state with a complete loss-of-function mutation, had a minor allele frequency of about 27% in European populations. It was noted that many unaffected homozygous individuals exist, including over 2,000 individuals from the control subset of the Genome Aggregation Database.
title: The contribution of common regulatory and protein-coding TYR variants in the genetic architecture of albinism

finding: The missense variant TYR c.575C>A [rs1042602] was shown to be relevant in influencing skin and hair pigmentation as well as macular thickness. It was documented that this variant contributed to decreased TYR enzymatic activity in vitro, thereby impacting albinism phenotypes.
title: The contribution of common regulatory and protein-coding TYR variants in the genetic architecture of albinism

finding: The study found that the sentinel variant rs5744249 from the IL-18 gene locus was associated with multiple outcomes including atrial fibrillation (AF), cardioembolic stroke, heart failure (HF), chronic kidney disease (CKD), and type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM). Colocalization analyses indicated that strong linkage disequilibrium (r^2 > 0.8) with at least one top variant from each outcome dataset, except for peripheral arterial disease, suggests potential causal relationships for the IL-18 signaling pathway with the specified cardiovascular and metabolic conditions.
title: Genetically Predicted IL-18 Inhibition and Risk of Cardiovascular Events: A Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: The SNP rs149483638 was associated with a lower risk for type 2 diabetes (T2D). It is located in the INS-IGF2 gene, which is situated near the INS gene, and the findings suggested that this SNP may influence the regulation of insulin gene expression through its impacts on the INS control region or proteins encoded by related genes.
title: The TH01 microsatellite and INS VNTR are strongly associated with type 2 diabetes and fasting insulin secretion

finding: The SNP rs3751033 exhibited a pleiotropic effect, influencing gene expression in both the hippocampus (for RP11-890B15) and hypothalamus (for SNX19). This finding related to schizophrenia (SZ) and highlighted the complexity of neuropsychiatric disorders.
title: Mendelian randomisation analysis using GWAS and eQTL data to investigate the relationship between chronotype and neuropsychiatric disorders and their molecular basis

finding: The rs8177399 variant in the TIRAP gene was identified as a lead rare variant associated with transferrin glycosylation and also functioned as an eQTL and sQTL for ST3GAL4.
title: Exome sequencing reveals aggregates of rare variants in glycosyltransferase and other genes influencing immunoglobulin G and transferrin glycosylation

finding: The SNP rs2508372 was identified and replicated as a novel association in the intergenic region between the genes PGR and TRPC6. This SNP has several plausible links to hypertensive disorders of pregnancy, specifically through its association with glomerular function, proteinuria, and renal dysfunction, which are important factors in the pathophysiology of preeclampsia.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis identifies novel maternal risk variants and enables polygenic prediction of preeclampsia and gestational hypertension

finding: This SNP was identified as associated with lifestyle factors influencing HF risk, specifically linked to alcohol consumption within the context of significant variants.
title: Common- and rare-variant genetic architecture of heart failure across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: The SNP rs10830963, located within the intron of the MTNR1B gene, was identified as the most significant genetic locus associated with gestational diabetes mellitus (GDM) susceptibility, exhibiting an odds ratio (OR) of 1.57 with a p-value of 4.42×10^-29. This genetic effect was pronounced for GDM but modest for type 2 diabetes.
title: Genome-wide association and Mendelian randomisation analysis among 30,699 Chinese pregnant women identifies novel genetic and molecular risk factors for gestational diabetes and glycaemic traits

finding: The SNP rs1003194 was associated with the <italic>CALCA</italic>/<italic>CALCB</italic> genes which encode CGRP, a significant finding related to migraine pathophysiology, particularly as it exhibited strong association at <italic>P</italic> = 2.43 × 10<sup>− 10</sup>.
title: Genome-wide analysis of 102,084 migraine cases identifies 123 risk loci and subtype-specific risk alleles

finding: The SNP rs11031122 was associated with the <italic>MPPED2</italic> locus as a MA-specific variant, showing a clear link to migraine with aura.
title: Genome-wide analysis of 102,084 migraine cases identifies 123 risk loci and subtype-specific risk alleles

finding: Lead SNP rs7116990 at the 11q21 locus showed significant associations related to alcohol exposure (p<sub>GE</sub>=1.80×10<sup>−5</sup>). The major allele (A) was linked to increased odds of NSCL/P for individuals with periconceptional alcohol use, contrasting with lowered odds in individuals without this exposure.
title: Genome-wide interaction study implicates VGLL2 and alcohol exposure and PRL and smoking in orofacial cleft risk

finding: The researchers revealed rs4409785 as a key genetic variant affecting the expression of <italic>SESN3</italic>. This SNP was identified as a strong caQTL with significant data showing that the risk allele leads to decreased expression of <italic>SESN3</italic>, thereby impacting T cell function and having implications for autoimmune diseases.
title: Multi-omics analysis in primary T cells elucidates mechanisms behind disease associated genetic loci

finding: Rs7943728 was noted as exhibiting a strong increase in chromatin accessibility linked to a protective allele, indicating a complex regulation mechanism influencing the local chromatin environment and gene interactions.
title: Multi-omics analysis in primary T cells elucidates mechanisms behind disease associated genetic loci

finding: The SNP rs968567 in the RA locus showed significant effects on chromatin accessibility and regulatory interactions, strongly correlating with increased expression of <italic>FADS1</italic> and <italic>FADS2</italic>, both playing a role in RA pathogenesis.
title: Multi-omics analysis in primary T cells elucidates mechanisms behind disease associated genetic loci

finding: The SNP rs174537 located in the FADS cluster was found to be strongly associated with low levels of n-3 long-chain polyunsaturated fatty acids (LC-PUFAs) among Hispanic populations with Amerind (AI) ancestry. This association included significant correlations with metabolic traits such as circulating triglycerides and E-selectin. For example, individuals who carried the T allele of rs174537 experienced higher levels of triglycerides (GT vs GG: β = 21.27 mg/dL, P = 0.0002; TT vs GG: β = 29.94 mg/dL, P = 1.01 x 10^-6). The findings highlighted a higher frequency of the ancestral T allele in high AI ancestry groups compared to other Hispanic subpopulations, where the T allele prevalence was around 40-55% in high AI groups versus <1% in African ancestry populations. Moreover, adjustment for rs174537 genotype illustrated that the relationship between AI ancestry and triglyceride levels remained significant, thereby underlining its vital role in predicting cardiovascular risk.
title: Amerind ancestry predicts the impact of FADS genetic variation on omega-3 PUFA deficiency, cardiometabolic and inflammatory risk in Hispanic populations

finding: The SNP rs174557, also within the FADS gene region, was examined and similarly associated with levels of LC-PUFAs. After adjusting for rs174557 genotype, the analysis revealed significant associations with the global proportion of AI ancestry and LC-PUFA levels, notably EPA (β = -0.30, P = 2.19 x 10^-11) and DHA (β = -1.39, P = 2.54 x 10^-15), paralleling the effects observed with rs174537. Furthermore, the presence of the A allele at rs174557 was found to correlate with lower levels of HDL-C, and higher waist-hip ratio, reflecting a shared impact on obesity-related traits similar to rs174537.
title: Amerind ancestry predicts the impact of FADS genetic variation on omega-3 PUFA deficiency, cardiometabolic and inflammatory risk in Hispanic populations

finding: The MUC5B promoter polymorphism rs35705950 was identified as a significant genetic variant associated with Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis (IPF). This SNP contributed to variations in clinical traits among patients with IPF, particularly impacting lung function and survival rates. Its presence was linked to distinct phenotypic clusters that indicated varying risk levels for IPF progression, which supports the hypothesis of multiple disease endotypes within the IPF patient population.
title: Cluster analysis of transcriptomic datasets to identify endotypes of Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis

finding: The SNP rs174528 was found to have a significant association with DHA, with a highly significant p-value of less than 1E-300, indicating its primary importance in the genetics of n-3 LCPUFA.
title: Fifty-one novel, replicated loci identified in genome-wide association study of polyunsaturated and monounsaturated fatty acids in 124,024 European individuals

finding: Similarly, rs509360 was significantly associated with omega-3 levels, also exhibiting a p-value of less than 1E-300, reaffirming the crucial role of FADS genes in n-3 LCPUFA genetics.
title: Fifty-one novel, replicated loci identified in genome-wide association study of polyunsaturated and monounsaturated fatty acids in 124,024 European individuals

finding: The SNP rs964184 was identified as the most significant independent association for MUFAs with a joint analysis p-value of 6.08E-207. This variant has consistently been associated with PUFA and MUFA traits across multiple GWAS.
title: Fifty-one novel, replicated loci identified in genome-wide association study of polyunsaturated and monounsaturated fatty acids in 124,024 European individuals

finding: The SNP rs9795439 in the 11p15.5 region was associated with the mode of anisotropy (MO) of the cingulum, with evidence of shared genetic architecture with chronotype.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: Identified at 11q24.1, rs3867239 showed genetic overlaps with multiple brain networks involving executive functions and sleep traits.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: The rs667730 variant located in the left/right putamen highlighted significant genetic influences on sleep.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: The rs174541 variant showed genetic connections with the left/right cerebellum's role in sleep.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: Within the 11p11.2 region, the SNP rs11605348 showed strong associations with myocardial-wall thickness and insomnia.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: In the 11p11.2 region, rs10838708 contributed to the genetic influences on heart structure, associated with insomnia.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: The MUC5B promoter polymorphism rs35705950 was associated with an increased risk for ARDS in critically ill adults aged 50 years or older. In the VALID cohort, the interaction analysis revealed that older patients exhibited a significantly elevated ARDS risk with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.44 (95% CI 1.08-1.92; p=0.012) per T allele, while younger patients showed an attenuated effect (OR: 0.84; 95% CI: 0.62-1.14; p=0.26). Additionally, in the BioVU cohort, this SNP was linked with an increased risk for EHR-ARDS (OR: 1.20; 95% CI: 1.00-1.43; p=0.043) unaffected by age. Furthermore, it was associated with greater oxygenation impairment in mechanically ventilated patients in BioVU.
title: Electronic health record biobank cohort recapitulates an association between the MUC5B promoter polymorphism and ARDS in critically ill adults

finding: The strongest variant associated with IPF, rs35705950 in the MUC5B locus, showed a 1.6-fold larger effect in males compared to females, indicating significant sex-heterogeneity.
title: Leveraging global multi-ancestry meta-analysis in the study of Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis genetics

finding: The SNP rs7107356 was identified near the AGBL2 gene with a genome-wide significant p-value of 1.43×10−10 in the European cohort. This locus was noted for its connections to taste preferences for bitter alcoholic beverages, which may influence alcohol consumption behaviors.
title: Genome-wide investigation of maximum habitual alcohol intake (MaxAlc) in 247,755 European and African Ancestry U.S. Veterans informs the relationship between habitual alcohol consumption and alcohol use disorder

finding: The SNP rs2514218 located near the DRD2 gene achieved a genome-wide significant association with a p-value of 4.59×10−08. This variant has previously been linked to alcohol consumption traits and problems.
title: Genome-wide investigation of maximum habitual alcohol intake (MaxAlc) in 247,755 European and African Ancestry U.S. Veterans informs the relationship between habitual alcohol consumption and alcohol use disorder

finding: The SNP rs10838725 in the CELF1 region was identified as a risk allele associated with Alzheimer's disease (AD). Analysis showed a significant decrease in CELF1 expression by 31.9% (p=0.021) in AD brains compared to controls, particularly when samples were classified by the presence of the risk SNP. Furthermore, this study established a strong correlation between CELF1 levels and KLC1 splice variants, especially KLC1_vB and KLC1_vE, suggesting that the relationship is direct and not simply a consequence of AD pathology.
title: An Alzheimer’s disease pathway uncovered by functional omics: the risk gene CELF1 regulates KLC1 splice variant E expression, which drives Aβ pathology

finding: The SNP rs6265, which is located in BDNF, was discovered to have a strong association with PAU and was categorized as one of the key findings within the broader set of 110 associated variants.
title: Multi-ancestry study of the genetics of problematic alcohol use in >1 million individuals

finding: The SNP rs35705950 in the promoter region of the MUC5B gene was identified as the largest genetic risk factor for idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF). In UK Biobank, it was associated with IPF risk, showing odds ratios (OR) ranging from 2.06 to 3.09. These findings were significantly lower than those from clinically-derived datasets, where the OR was reported as 5.06 (95% CI: 4.69, 5.47). The SNP's presence was associated with a 4-5 times increased risk of IPF, and it may account for more variation in disease susceptibility than other common IPF SNPs combined, indicating its critical role in understanding genetic contributions to IPF.
title: Using genetic information to define idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis in UK Biobank

finding: The genetic variant rs117203606 was found at 11p12, intergenic to LINC02740 and HNRNPKP3, and showed a strong association with CAP (p=2.90×10⁻⁸), suggesting an important new risk locus.
title: A genome-wide association study of adults with community-acquired pneumonia

finding: The SNP rs11235667 was previously associated with Crohn's Disease in a genome-wide association study (GWAS). It fell within a peak that was in the top 10% of similar peaks for the dendritic cell populations M-9 and M-12, highlighting its potential role in mediating genetic risk for autoimmune conditions.
title: Dynamic regulatory elements in single-cell multimodal data capture autoimmune disease heritability and implicate key immune cell states

finding: The SNP rs2155219 was linked to inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) and was located within a peak in the top 10% of similar peaks for the cell state M-6, suggesting its relevance in genetic predisposition to autoimmune diseases.
title: Dynamic regulatory elements in single-cell multimodal data capture autoimmune disease heritability and implicate key immune cell states

finding: The SNP rs11236797 also showed an association with inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) and was found within the peak chr11:76588012-76589212, which is among the top 10% of similar peaks for the cell state M-6, indicating its potential impact on genetic risk factors for autoimmune disorders.
title: Dynamic regulatory elements in single-cell multimodal data capture autoimmune disease heritability and implicate key immune cell states

finding: This SNP was the top association in the OUD-MTAG analysis, linked to both the TMX2 and CTNND1 genes, suggesting its potential relevance in the genetic landscape of OUD.
title: Genome-wide association study and multi-trait analysis of opioid use disorder identifies novel associations in 639,709 individuals of European and African ancestry

finding: This SNP associated with the NCAM1 gene showed a GWS association in the OUD-MTAG analysis, contributing to the genetic understanding of OUD components.
title: Genome-wide association study and multi-trait analysis of opioid use disorder identifies novel associations in 639,709 individuals of European and African ancestry

finding: The SNP rs7933438 was prioritized as the causal variant at the locus associated with T2D and linked to a specific T2D signal involving the transcription factor ETS1. The finding contributed to understanding the genetic basis of T2D.
title: Modeling islet enhancers using deep learning identifies candidate causal variants at loci associated with T2D and glycemic traits

finding: The SNP rs75336838 was prioritized as the functional variant at the 11:7117503 locus near PSMA1, associated with HbA1c and glucose. The T allele was predicted to increase enhancer probability and showed significant allelic differences in transcription factor binding, demonstrating its importance in the genetic architecture of these traits.
title: Modeling islet enhancers using deep learning identifies candidate causal variants at loci associated with T2D and glycemic traits

finding: The SNP rs11030404 was associated with elevated total serum IgE levels, which in turn correlated with a reduced risk of both IDH wildtype and IDH mutant glioma. The findings indicated that elevated IgE might potentially relate to a protective immune response against glioma, particularly highlighting the significance of IgE levels in determining glioma prognosis.
title: Association of immunoglobulin E levels with glioma risk and survival

finding: The SNP rs11236938 in TSKU was identified as being significantly associated with the combined drug response, particularly in relation to tamoxifen and non-chemotherapy agents.
title: Exome-wide association study reveals 7 functional variants associated with ex-vivo drug response in acute myeloid leukemia patients

finding: The variant p.G78V, represented by the SNP rs963128995, was identified in a cohort of 100 dilated cardiomyopathy (DCM) cases. It was a reported variant, absent in 100 ethnicity-matched control individuals. Functional studies indicated that this missense variant resulted in a reduction of the CSRP3 protein level, impaired binding with alpha-Actinin, and led to downregulation of target genes related to muscle function.
title: Mutations in CSRP3/MLP, a Z-disc associated gene are functionally associated with dilated cardiomyopathy in Indian population

finding: The rs1847639939 variant, located in the AMPD3 gene, interacted with long total sleep time (LTST) in its association with low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-c), highlighting its role in lipid regulation affected by sleep duration.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Gene-Sleep Interaction Study in 732,564 Participants Identifies Lipid Loci Explaining Sleep-Associated Lipid Disturbances

finding: The rs59374498 variant, located in the TEAD1/RASSF10 genes, was associated with TG levels in the context of LTST, indicating its importance in sleep-linked lipid metabolism.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Gene-Sleep Interaction Study in 732,564 Participants Identifies Lipid Loci Explaining Sleep-Associated Lipid Disturbances

finding: The variant rs2237892 at KCNQ1 was recognized as a known association with T2D, demonstrating statistical significance in the marginal test within the adult group.
title: Summary statistics from large-scale gene-environment interaction studies for re-analysis and meta-analysis

finding: The SNP rs10830963 was identified as a unique co-localizing lead variant in the gene MTNR1B. It had been extensively studied and linked with increased type 2 diabetes risk in various populations.
title: Identification of novel type 1 and type 2 diabetes genes by co-localization of human islet eQTL and GWAS variants with colocRedRibbon

finding: This SNP was highlighted as a robust indicator of colocalization for various fatty acid traits, suggesting shared genetic influences.
title: Genome-wide association studies and multi-omics integrative analysis reveal novel loci and their molecular mechanisms for circulating polyunsaturated, monounsaturated, and saturated fatty acids

finding: Identified as a potential causal variant in the FADS1 locus, it demonstrated significant overlap with QTL signals for gene expression and methylation, linking it to PUFA pathways.
title: Genome-wide association studies and multi-omics integrative analysis reveal novel loci and their molecular mechanisms for circulating polyunsaturated, monounsaturated, and saturated fatty acids

finding: This SNP was noted for having colocalization with various fatty acid traits and was identified as having potential causal implications in metabolic processes.
title: Genome-wide association studies and multi-omics integrative analysis reveal novel loci and their molecular mechanisms for circulating polyunsaturated, monounsaturated, and saturated fatty acids

finding: Identified as a potential causal variant for fatty acid traits, suggesting its importance in metabolic contexts.
title: Genome-wide association studies and multi-omics integrative analysis reveal novel loci and their molecular mechanisms for circulating polyunsaturated, monounsaturated, and saturated fatty acids

finding: This variant was found to be associated with the DGKZ locus and showed relevance to multiple molecular phenotypes.
title: Genome-wide association studies and multi-omics integrative analysis reveal novel loci and their molecular mechanisms for circulating polyunsaturated, monounsaturated, and saturated fatty acids

finding: This SNP was associated with omega-3% and linked to multiple molecular phenotypes, indicating its importance in metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association studies and multi-omics integrative analysis reveal novel loci and their molecular mechanisms for circulating polyunsaturated, monounsaturated, and saturated fatty acids

finding: This SNP showed consistent associations with various molecular phenotypes related to omega-3 PUFAs.
title: Genome-wide association studies and multi-omics integrative analysis reveal novel loci and their molecular mechanisms for circulating polyunsaturated, monounsaturated, and saturated fatty acids

finding: Linked to fatty acid traits, indicating potential functional relevance in metabolic pathways.
title: Genome-wide association studies and multi-omics integrative analysis reveal novel loci and their molecular mechanisms for circulating polyunsaturated, monounsaturated, and saturated fatty acids

finding: This SNP had been previously reported in a Japanese and European meta-analysis, confirming its association with atopic dermatitis.
title: European and multi-ancestry genome-wide association meta-analysis of atopic dermatitis highlights importance of systemic immune regulation

finding: This SNP was noted as novel and linked to SIK3, a kinase potentially influencing skin barrier dysfunction and inflammation.
title: European and multi-ancestry genome-wide association meta-analysis of atopic dermatitis highlights importance of systemic immune regulation

finding: It was significantly associated with immune cell types, providing insights into genetic influences on immune cell distribution.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals different T cell distributions in peripheral blood of healthy individuals at high genetic risk of type 1 diabetes and long COVID

finding: The SNP rs28737416 T allele was associated with lower concentrations of TNF and IFN-gamma in the CSF of TBM patients. Specifically, participants with T/T and T/C genotypes had higher susceptibility to TB meningitis (TBM) compared to those with the C/C genotype, indicated by an odds ratio (OR) of 1.24 and a p-value of 0.021. Furthermore, increased mortality rates were observed in participants possessing the T/T and T/C genotypes, with 30.4% mortality compared to 12.4% in the C/C group (log-rank p=0.005). This association was confirmed in independent cohorts from Vietnam and Indonesia.
title: MUC5AC genetic variation is associated with tuberculosis meningitis CSF cytokine responses and mortality

finding: The SNP rs10732516, located at the IGF2/H19 locus, was associated with a genotype-specific trend in placental DNA methylation and was linked to head circumference in prenatally alcohol-exposed newborns. This finding illustrated how genetic variations could influence the impact of prenatal alcohol exposure on developmental outcomes.
title: Chromatin remodeler developmental pluripotency associated factor 4 (DPPA4) is a candidate gene for alcohol-induced developmental disorders

finding: Carriers of the Prothrombin G20210A variant (rs1799963) were also identified as individuals with inherited thrombophilia, contributing to the doubled risk for post-Covid VTE, reinforcing the clinical significance of these genetic variants in the context of Covid-19-related complications.
title: Venous Thromboembolism in Ambulatory Covid-19 patients: Clinical and Genetic Determinants

finding: The MUC5B promoter variant rs35705950 was identified as a strong common risk factor for idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF). The risk of developing pulmonary fibrosis was significantly higher for individuals carrying this disease allele, with odds being 5 times greater for one copy and 20 times greater for two copies compared to those with no copies. The allele frequency was around 9% in European ancestry populations, linking its presence directly to increased IPF risk.
title: The causal relationship between gastro-esophageal reflux disease and idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis: A bidirectional two-sample Mendelian randomization study

finding: SNP rs35233100 was predicted to have a stop-gained mutation affecting neuronal cell function and was significantly associated with eQTLs in brain, suggesting its role in AD pathology.
title: Cell-type Specific Expression Quantitative Trait Loci Associated with Alzheimer Disease in Blood and Brain Tissue

finding: The chr11:34482745:G:A SNP demonstrated a significant association with COVID-19 severity through involvement in the ELF5 gene, particularly noted in the meta-analysis across multiple studies.
title: A genome-wide association study of COVID-19 related hospitalization in Spain reveals genetic disparities among sexes

finding: The rs4755720 variant was associated with heart failure risk factors including BMI, HDL-C, T2DM, and coronary artery disease (CAD), demonstrating its contribution to heart failure risk.
title: Genome-wide association analysis and Mendelian randomization proteomics identify novel protein biomarkers and drug targets for primary prevention of heart failure

finding: The rs73398698 variant was identified as a tag for the <HBB> locus concerning 'Sickle Cell Anemia' with both association methods revealing it, while noting the GWAS association had a two-fold higher odds ratio compared to AM.
title: Systematic comparison of phenome-wide admixture mapping and genome-wide association in a diverse biobank

finding: The rs35705950 variant located in the promoter region of the MUC5B gene was associated with increased risk of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF) with an odds ratio greater than 4. However, it was noted that this allele acted in an opposite manner for severe COVID-19, as it was protective against the severity of the disease.
title: Genetic overlap between idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis and COVID−19

finding: The rs77599934 variant, situated within the DDIAS gene, was associated with the risk of COVID-19 hospitalization (OR=2.27, 95% CI=1.70-3.04, p=2.26×10^-8), representing a novel finding not previously reported in other GWAS studies.
title: Novel risk loci for COVID-19 hospitalization among admixed American populations

finding: The rs10830963 SNP in the MTNR1B gene was investigated in relation to gestational diabetes (GDM). It was found to interact with lifestyle interventions affecting the occurrence of GDM. This finding provided an important context for the genetic predisposition to GDM, particularly in South Asian women, as the SNP was associated with the risk of developing GDM.
title: The Genetic Risk of Gestational Diabetes in South Asian women

finding: Located in the intronic region of the NCAM1 gene as part of the super variant chr11_114, which had an OR of 1.321 (p=7.03×10^-7) pertaining to COVID-19 related mortality.
title: Deep learning identified genetic variants associated with COVID-19 related mortality

finding: This SNP was included in the chr11_114 super variant, associated with COVID-19 mortality risk, exhibiting an OR of 1.321 and p-value of 7.03×10^-7.
title: Deep learning identified genetic variants associated with COVID-19 related mortality

finding: The SNP rs1126809, associated with the variant TYR:c.1205G>A (p.Arg402Gln), was found to significantly increase the probability of receiving a diagnosis of albinism when present in a heterozygous state alongside rs74653330 (odds ratio 12.8; 95% confidence interval 6.0 – 24.7; p-value 2.1 x 10^-8). This finding was corroborated by data from both the University Hospital of Bordeaux cohort and an independent study in the UK Biobank.
title: The co-occurrence of genetic variants in the TYR and OCA2 genes confers susceptibility to albinism

finding: Similar to rs2073505, this SNP was previously reported in a GWAS. However, a new coding variant was discovered and reported for the first time in this study, directly implicating its associated gene in Crohn's disease risk.
title: Sequencing of over 100,000 individuals identifies multiple genes and rare variants associated with Crohns disease susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs35705950 was found to be a well-known IPF-associated variant at locus 11p15.5, specifically in the promoter region of MUC5B. It had a strong association with IPF, given an odds ratio (OR) of 2.94 [2.40, 3.60] and a highly significant P-value of 2.09×10^-25.
title: Common and rare variant analyses reveal novel genetic factors underlying Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis and shared aetiology with COVID-19

finding: The SNP rs61869029, associated with the BRSK2 gene, was connected to neuron polarization and axonogenesis and demonstrated specific associations within DA-midbrain tissues in H-MAGMA analyses, indicating its involvement in neurological functions relevant to sensation seeking.
title: Neurogenetic and multi-omic sources of overlap among sensation seeking, alcohol consumption, and alcohol use disorder

finding: The SNP rs174576 was associated with blood pressure-related phospholipids that were identified in a genome-wide significant manner and linked to traits in the metabolic domain, particularly regarding lipoproteins and blood cell counts.
title: A multi-omics study of circulating phospholipid markers of blood pressure

finding: rs740006 was reported as significantly associated with blood pressure-related phospholipids, recognized for its relevance to metabolic and cardiovascular traits.
title: A multi-omics study of circulating phospholipid markers of blood pressure

finding: This variant was reported as the most significant for CSF sTREM2 levels across several cohorts (P=4.29×10^-62), tagging the MS4A locus. It was linked to multiple missense variants, which had been previously identified as relevant in the context of AD.
title: Proteo-genomics of soluble TREM2 in cerebrospinal fluid provides novel insights and identifies novel modulators for Alzheimer’s disease

finding: This variant was identified as a secondary signal within the MS4A locus and showed association with sTREM2 levels (P=6.38×10^-16) after conditioning on the sentinel variant rs72918674, further bolstering the evidence for the MS4A locus's role in AD.
title: Proteo-genomics of soluble TREM2 in cerebrospinal fluid provides novel insights and identifies novel modulators for Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The missense variant p.A112T strongly associated with CSF sTREM2 levels (P not explicitly stated but strongly implied to be significant) indicating its contribution to the TREM2 pathway and potentially AD risk.
title: Proteo-genomics of soluble TREM2 in cerebrospinal fluid provides novel insights and identifies novel modulators for Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The C allele of the rs12252 variant in the IFITM3 gene was identified as a genetic risk factor for hospitalization and severe outcomes of COVID-19, indicating its significance in viral entry modulation.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: The rs11246066 variant was connected to increased expression of IFITM3, exhibiting a population frequency that potentially correlates with COVID-19 susceptibility.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: This SNP, associated with increased IFITM2 expression, recorded the highest allele frequency in the Indian cohort, suggesting potential implications for advantageous outcomes in COVID-19.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: Linked to IFITM2 expression, the rs7931303 SNP in Indians was associated with higher frequency levels, indicating a potential function in COVID-19 susceptibility.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: Associated with an Alu insertion impacting PGR expression, the rs1042838 variant demonstrated frequency patterns in Indians that may modulate ACE2 expression and affect COVID-19 susceptibility.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: The SNP rs6598045, associated with decreased case fatality rate, showed lower frequency in the Indian population, indicating possible implications in COVID-19 severity.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: The SNP was associated with lung cancer through its effect on the CHEK1 gene, showing considerable association especially in lung squamous cell carcinomas, thereby qualifying as a positive original finding.
title: Genetic analysis of lung cancer reveals novel susceptibility loci and germline impact on somatic mutation burden

finding: The rs1800057-G missense variant in the ATM gene showed an odds ratio (OR) of 1.28 (95% CI 1.18-1.37) and a p-value of 1.3 x 10^-10, correlating decreased ATM function with increased CHIP risk, aligning with its implications in tumorigenesis.
