finding: This SNP, rs4672, was categorized as a missense variant within FKBP2, a gene not listed in ClinVar. Its significance was marked in the context of bipolar disorder (BD), supporting a functional role in the condition.
title: Fine-mapping genomic loci refines bipolar disorder risk genes

finding: The SNP rs180917274 was significant (p=6.7E-03) in relation to tuberculosis, aligning with previously documented associations in genetic literature.
title: Large Registry Based Analysis of Genetic Predisposition to Tuberculosis Identifies Genetic Risk Factors at HLA

finding: The SNP rs471994 was identified as a cis-pQTL for MMP1, demonstrating its influence on the levels of this matrix metalloproteinase and suggesting its implications in inflammatory processes.
title: Mapping pQTLs of circulating inflammatory proteins identifies drivers of immune-related disease risk and novel therapeutic targets

finding: This SNP was determined to be a cis-pQTL for CD5, which is involved in the regulation of immune responses.
title: Mapping pQTLs of circulating inflammatory proteins identifies drivers of immune-related disease risk and novel therapeutic targets

finding: SNP rs34312154 was identified among 40 SNPs potentially harmful due to a high CADD score of 31, impacting genes from HOXB1 to HOXB8. Its association indicated a communication link between eGFR and cardiovascular traits, emphasizing its significance in the genomic analysis.
title: Disentangling shared genetic etiologies for kidney function and cardiovascular diseases

finding: This SNP was identified as a causal variant influencing MUC5B expression, with its T allele associated with increased expression in IPF cases. This signal demonstrated strong colocalization with GWAS data, highlighting its significant role in the pathophysiology of both critically ill COVID-19 and IPF.
title: Context-specific eQTLs reveal causal genes underlying shared genetic architecture of critically ill COVID-19 and idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis

finding: The rs1815739 polymorphism in ACTN3 was found to significantly modify the association between walking pace and lung cancer risk. Participants carrying a higher number of T alleles exhibited a more pronounced protective effect associated with brisk walking pace, with a P-interaction value of 0.04 for both lung cancer incidence and mortality. The HR of incident lung cancer associated with brisk walking pace was 0.47 for TT genotype carriers, indicating a substantial reduction in risk compared to slow walkers.
title: Endurance and power genes modify the protective effect of fast walking pace on lung cancer risk: a UK Biobank prospective cohort study

finding: The rs9787874 variant at the PICALM locus was associated with top PAR estimates in individuals of Latino, East Asian, Black/African American, and European ancestry, showcasing its relevance in Alzheimer's disease across diverse groups.
title: Multi-ancestry population attributable risk assessment of common genetic variation in Alzheimer’s and Parkinson’s diseases

finding: SNP rs757081 was classified as potentially deleterious and identified as part of the independent risk loci associated with chronic pain.
title: The genetic architecture of pain intensity in a sample of 598,339 U.S. veterans

finding: Identified as a significant novel locus associated with PCOS, this SNP is situated on chromosome 11 and acts as an eQTL for the RNA gene RP11-736K20. The association was found in the context of a comprehensive meta-analysis of PCOS involving a substantial number of cases and controls.
title: Understanding and Predicting Polycystic Ovary Syndrome through Shared Genetic Architecture with Testosterone, SHBG, and Inflammatory Markers

finding: In locus 11q13.2, rs662094 showed colocalization with chronotype and muscle fat infiltration, establishing a link between genetics and sleep.
title: The role of sleep in the human brain and body: insights from multi-organ imaging genetics

finding: Found in the intron of PRR5L, it was the top SNP in prioritization with substantial evidence demonstrating strong expression in AD contexts.
title: Triangulating molecular evidence to prioritise candidate causal genes at established atopic dermatitis loci

finding: This SNP also resided in the intron of PRR5L and was prioritized for its role in eczema through eQTL overlap.
title: Triangulating molecular evidence to prioritise candidate causal genes at established atopic dermatitis loci

finding: The SNP rs2075654 in the DRD2 gene was found to be associated with long-term remission of obesity in a retrospective cohort study conducted on Chinese children and adolescents with obesity. This finding highlighted the potential genetic influence on childhood obesity, indicating that variation in the DRD2 gene could serve as a significant factor in obesity risk and management.
title: The association of personality traits with childhood obesity: a systematic review and meta-analysis

finding: The rs1582763 variant in the MS4A4A gene demonstrated a protective effect against delirium (Odds Ratio of 0.991, p < 0.05), indicating its possible importance in neuroinflammatory processes related to both Alzheimer Disease and delirium.
title: Dissecting the genetic and proteomic risk factors for delirium

finding: The SNP rs4586205 was significantly associated with the gene DRD2 and indicated a notable connection to oral cavity cancer risk in the study's findings.
title: Integrated multi-omics data analysis identifies a novel genetics-risk gene of IRF4 associated with prognosis of oral cavity cancer

finding: The SNP rs34598529, located in the HBB gene associated with sickle cell disease, demonstrated a significantly higher minor allele frequency in the African American IBD cluster (cluster MAF: 2.2e-3, p-value: 1.52e-9) versus the biobank overall (MAF: 3.023e-5). This finding was in line with expectations given the association of HBB with African ancestry.
title: Health care utilization of fine-scale identity by descent clusters in a Los Angeles biobank

finding: The SNP rs34999973, also found in the HBB gene, showed increased allele frequency in the African American IBD cluster (cluster MAF: 2.89e-4, p-value: 2.9e-4), while no significant variants were seen in the Afro-Caribbean cluster, indicating it was specifically notable for African American populations.
title: Health care utilization of fine-scale identity by descent clusters in a Los Angeles biobank

finding: The SNP rs1126809-A was identified as a significant variant in TYR, associated with thickening of the RPE layer, highlighting its importance in retinal structural integrity.
title: Insights into human health from phenome- and genome-wide analyses of UK Biobank retinal optical coherence tomography phenotypes

finding: The risk allele of the T2D index variant rs529623 was linked to lower expression of FXYD2 in pancreatic islets, with significant downregulation noted in T2D patients' pancreatic islet beta cells, suggesting a potential pathway through which diabetes may affect gene expression.
title: Multi-omics characterization of type 2 diabetes associated genetic variation

finding: The low-frequency variant rs145341070 (MAF=1.0%) was identified to increase the risk for panniculitis by almost 15-fold (OR: 14.96). The candidate gene associated was MYEOV.
title: Genetic architecture and shared mechanisms of common ‘neglected’ diseases

finding: The SNP rs61890184, associated with the gene PPFIBP2, significantly contributed to the individual response to neoadjuvant androgen deprivation therapy (NADT). It was part of a mediation analysis that showed its interplay with CMB 236 and was associated with treatment response in patients.
title: AI-Powered cellular morphometric biomarkers discovered in needle biopsy of prostatic cancer predict neoadjuvant androgen deprivation therapy response and prognosis: an international multicenter retrospective study

finding: The variant rs1582763 was identified as a protective factor in Alzheimer disease (AD). It was associated with elevated cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) sTREM2 levels and reduced AD risk. Gene expression analyses revealed that this variant increased the expression of MS4A4A and facilitated a shift towards an interferon state in a specific microglial subpopulation (Mic.3), resulting in reduced inflammatory responses and enhanced lipid metabolism pathways.
title: MS4A4A modifies the risk of Alzheimer disease by regulating lipid metabolism and immune response in a unique microglia state

finding: The rs6591561 variant, associated with increased AD risk, demonstrated decreased levels of CSF sTREM2 and was linked to higher inflammatory responses. In microglial state analyses, this variant led to a reduction in MS4A4A expression and promoted pathways associated with inflammasome activation and intracellular cholesterol storage, thereby contributing to the higher risk of AD.
title: MS4A4A modifies the risk of Alzheimer disease by regulating lipid metabolism and immune response in a unique microglia state

finding: The variant rs35705950-T in the MUC5B gene was associated with a reduced risk of hospitalizations due to COVID-19, with an odds ratio (OR) of 0.86 in the Million Veteran Program (N=25353 cases, N=631024 controls; p=7.4 × 10^-5) and OR of 0.89 in a trans-ethnic meta-analysis with the COVID-19 Host Genetics Initiative (N=1641311; p=1.9 × 10^-6). Additionally, individuals of European ancestry with at least one copy of rs35705950-T experienced fewer post-COVID pneumonia events (OR=0.85; p=0.008). This finding suggested that the presence of the T allele might be protective against the severity of COVID-19, contrasting with its established role as a risk factor for idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF).
title: A MUC5B gene polymorphism, rs35705950-T, confers protective effects in COVID-19 infection

finding: The SNP rs174561 was shown to overlap with cis-miR-eQTLs for miR-1908-5p, which was related to metabolites involved in lipid and obesity traits, highlighting its role in metabolic pathways.
title: An atlas of genetic regulation and disease associations of microRNAs

finding: Rs7130989 was associated with hypertension at a significant level, reflecting its potential impact on blood pressure regulation.
title: An atlas of genetic regulation and disease associations of microRNAs

finding: The SNP rs1131665 correlated with the meQTL for IRF7 and was observed in both neutrophils and naive CD4+ T cells of lupus patients, reflecting its role in lupus-associated epigenetic changes.
title: Hypomethylation of miR-17-92 cluster in lupus T cells and no significant role for genetic factors in the lupus-associated DNA methylation signature

finding: The study found that the MUC5B rs35705950 SNP, associated with interstitial lung disease (ILD), showed a significant difference in allele frequency among groups. Unaffected relatives had a frequency of the risk allele 'T' at 18.8%, while this frequency was much higher at 45.2% in known ILD patients and 35.7% in relatives with preclinical ILD. This finding underlines the genetic predisposition to ILD in affected families and reinforces the importance of genetic screening.
title: Preclinical interstitial lung disease in relatives of familial pulmonary fibrosis patients

finding: The SNP rs75393320 was found on chromosome 11 within the ACP2 gene. It was associated with anti-NMDAR encephalitis, with a genome-wide significance (P = 3.78 × 10^-8) and an OR of 2.20, suggesting a significant genetic risk factor for this autoimmune condition.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies two new loci associated with anti-NMDAR encephalitis

finding: The SNP rs11039155, also located on chromosome 11, was situated in the NR1H3 gene. Similar to rs75393320, it exhibited the same P-value (P = 3.78 × 10^-8) and OR (2.20), indicating its significant association with anti-NMDAR encephalitis, reinforcing its role in the genetic susceptibility to this disease.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies two new loci associated with anti-NMDAR encephalitis

finding: The SNP rs174546, when genetically elevated for PUFA desaturase activity, was associated with a higher risk of colorectal and lung cancer. This association was believed to be mediated through increased inflammation, suggesting a link between fatty acid metabolism and cancer risk.
title: Relationship between Polyunsaturated Fatty Acids and Inflammation: evidence from cohort and Mendelian randomization analyses

finding: The SNP rs1944683 was identified as a lead SNP associated with substance use disorders (SUDs) in African-ancestry individuals. It was previously not genome-wide significant in this population but had been linked to various substance-related behaviors in European populations. Notably, it showed significant associations with regular smoking and tobacco-related medical conditions, reinforcing its relevance to substance-related traits.
title: Combining Transdiagnostic and Disorder-Level GWAS Enhances Precision of Psychiatric Genetic Risk Profiles in a Multi-Ancestry Sample

finding: The SNP rs3847634 was identified as a genome-wide significant locus mapped to the ARL14EP gene on chromosome 11. It was associated with a stronger morningness effect of daytime light exposure on chronotype, indicating enhanced light sensitivity. Additional T alleles at this SNP corresponded with increased ARL14EP expression in brain and retina tissues and showed reduced methylation and increased H3K27ac histone modifications, linking it to greater eveningness effects as well.
title: Genome-wide gene by environment study of time spent in daylight and chronotype identifies emerging genetic architecture underlying light sensitivity

finding: The SNP rs35705950 has been linked to lower prevalence of qualifying variants (QVs) in individuals. It was noted that carriers of risk alleles (TT or TC genotype) had a prevalence of QVs at 13.5%, in stark contrast to 22.6% in protective GG genotype carriers, indicating a relevant interaction between this variant and QV burden.
title: Rare variants and survival of patients with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis

finding: The study identified rs174547 as being significantly associated with blood arachidonic acid (ARA) levels at a p-value of 3.0×10^-971. This SNP was retained for 2-stage Mendelian randomisation to evaluate its causal effects on self-reported colorectal polyp outcomes. Although elevated ARA was studied in association with colorectal polyp incidence, no significant association was found (OR= 1.00, P-value = 0.50). Thus, while rs174547 was recognized as an original finding related to ARA levels, it did not show a positive association with colorectal polyp incidence.
title: Investigation of the association between high arachidonic acid synthesis and colorectal polyp incidence: a Mendelian randomisation approach

finding: Prior research indicated that rs174537, a variant within the fatty acid desaturase 1 (FADS1) gene, had been studied regarding its association with colorectal adenoma risk. The study reported no significant association (OR= 1.07, P=0.41) between rs174537 and colorectal polyps, suggesting that this genetic variant did not influence adenoma risk in the tested population.
title: Investigation of the association between high arachidonic acid synthesis and colorectal polyp incidence: a Mendelian randomisation approach

finding: This variant near DRD2 was strongly linked to AUD, playing a potential role in alcohol behavioral responses.
title: Genetic underpinnings of the transition from alcohol consumption to alcohol use disorder: shared and unique genetic architectures in a cross-ancestry sample

finding: Identified near TMX2, this variant had noteworthy direct effects on AUD.
title: Genetic underpinnings of the transition from alcohol consumption to alcohol use disorder: shared and unique genetic architectures in a cross-ancestry sample

finding: This SNP was recognized for its strength in association with AUD, marking it as a relevant genetic variant.
title: Genetic underpinnings of the transition from alcohol consumption to alcohol use disorder: shared and unique genetic architectures in a cross-ancestry sample

finding: The SNP rs116714277 at the ARAP1/STARD10 locus on 11q13.4 was identified as genome-wide significant with a p-value of 2.8 × 10-8. It was primarily associated with fructosamine and glycated albumin, implicating it in glycemic pathways.
title: Characterizing common and rare variations in non-traditional glycemic biomarkers using multivariate approaches on multi-ancestry ARIC study

finding: The SNP rs2438321 at the RP11-115E19.1 locus on 11q22.1 was identified with a genome-wide significant p-value of 1.3 × 10-8 in African ancestry individuals, indicating its relevance to glycemic biomarkers.
title: Characterizing common and rare variations in non-traditional glycemic biomarkers using multivariate approaches on multi-ancestry ARIC study

finding: The lead SNP rs12792379 located at the CCKBR locus was notably linked with higher expression levels of this receptor in various tissues. It showed a PUD risk allele in linkage disequilibrium with the eQTL allele, emphasizing the role of CCKBR in HP-dependent ulceration processes.
title: East Asian-specific and cross-ancestry genome-wide meta-analyses provide mechanistic insights into peptic ulcer disease

finding: The SNP rs592068 exhibited a role as an expression-increasing variant of GPR83 that showed a statistical epistatic interaction with the MC3R SNP rs3746619. This interaction suggested that increased GPR83 expression contributed to earlier AAM by amplifying the signals through the MC3R pathway.
title: Understanding the genetic complexity of puberty timing across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: The SNP rs11031006 was linked with both AAM and age at natural menopause (ANM), showing genome-wide significance. This association suggested that it plays a role in reproductive timing and indicates that manipulation of HPG axis components could have implications for developmental timing.
title: Understanding the genetic complexity of puberty timing across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: The missense variant rs12793348-G was noted as a novel finding in PANX1 locus, associated with autoimmune thyroid disease markers such as TPOAb positivity.
title: Genome-wide association studies of thyroid-related hormones, dysfunction, and autoimmunity among 85,421 Chinese pregnancies

finding: Although the SNP rs964184 was linked to the overall results of the study, it was noted that this SNP might weaken the observed effect of higher α-tocopherol levels on schizophrenia. The overall results were considered robust, despite the potential influence of rs964184, which was associated with cholesterol and triglycerides, suggesting a complex interaction between cholesterol metabolism and antioxidant effects.
title: Investigating Causal Associations of Diet-Derived Circulating Antioxidants with Risk of Six Major Mental Disorders: A Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: The rs73404549 variant exhibited a strong association with sickle cell anemia in the African population. It was found to be in high linkage disequilibrium with rs334 (c.20A>T, p.Glu7Val, HbS), a well-established pathogenic variant, but was not included in the TOPMed reference panel.
title: Decoding Genetics, Ancestry, and Geospatial Context for Precision Health

finding: The rs33930165 SNP (c.19G>A, p.Glu7Lys) in the HBB gene was noted for conferring malarial resistance without causing sickle cell anemia. A significant finding was observed in participants with both sickle cell anemia and this variant, as they showed lower red blood cell counts compared to heterozygous individuals for either genotype.
title: Decoding Genetics, Ancestry, and Geospatial Context for Precision Health

finding: Detected at the BDNF locus, rs61888800 showed a high mapping frequency across 39 cell types and was significant for its association with gene regulation linked to obesity and anti-depression.
title: 3D genomic features across >50 diverse cell types reveal insights into the genomic architecture of childhood obesity

finding: This SNP was linked to the METTL15 locus and shown to colocalize with the gene's expression in tibial artery tissues, adding to its relevance in childhood obesity genetic studies.
title: 3D genomic features across >50 diverse cell types reveal insights into the genomic architecture of childhood obesity

finding: The SNP rs12576934, located near the LRRC4C gene on chromosome 11, showed a genome-wide significant association with Alzheimer's Disease (AD) across multiple ancestries, including Non-Hispanic White (NHW) and Hispanic individuals, with a P-value of 5.4×10^-9. It indicated an odds ratio (OR) of 1.12, suggesting the minor allele C increased the risk of AD.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide meta-analysis of 56,241 individuals identifies LRRC4C, LHX5-AS1 and nominates ancestry-specific loci PTPRK, GRB14, and KIAA0825 as novel risk loci for Alzheimer’s disease: the Alzheimer’s Disease Genetics Consortium

finding: The SNP rs11606884 was also part of the seven novel loci discovered in the study. Similar to rs11065577, this SNP had not been reported in previous GWAS but showed suggestive associations (p<.05) with metabolic traits, linking it to the genetic risk factors shared between MDD and CVD.
title: Distinct biological signature and modifiable risk factors underly the comorbidity between major depressive disorder and cardiovascular disease

finding: The SNP rs500571 was included among the seven novel loci identified within the latent MDD-CVD relationship. It had not been previously reported in any GWAS but did show suggestive associations (p<.05) with metabolic traits, potentially contributing to the shared genetic risk factors between MDD and CVD.
title: Distinct biological signature and modifiable risk factors underly the comorbidity between major depressive disorder and cardiovascular disease

finding: The SNP rs11031006 was linked to the FSHB locus at 11p14.1, with a significant P-value of 1.17x10-3, suggesting its possible role in endometriosis.
title: Enhancing Genetic Association Power in Endometriosis through Unsupervised Clustering of Clinical Subtypes Identified from Electronic Health Records

finding: The SNP rs72638188 associated with the WT1 locus at 11p14.1 achieved a significant P-value of 2.85x10-4, indicating its relevance in the context of endometriosis.
title: Enhancing Genetic Association Power in Endometriosis through Unsupervised Clustering of Clinical Subtypes Identified from Electronic Health Records

finding: SNP rs641325 was reported to be related to increased risks of both PTSD and FSA, marking its importance in the investigation of genetic factors associated with PTSD.
title: The genetic relationships between post-traumatic stress disorder and its corresponding neural circuit structures

finding: Mapped to the NTM gene and showed strong evidence for shared genetic risk with schizophrenia and ADHD traits, marking it as a significant autism-related SNP.
title: Exploring autism and autism co-occurring condition associations to elucidate multivariate genetic mechanisms and insights

finding: The SNP rs554219 was situated on chromosome 11q13 upstream of the CCND1 gene and demonstrated a hazard ratio of 1.24 with a P-value of 3.0 × 10^-22. This SNP was also part of observed haplotypes associated with breast cancer risk, indicating it played a crucial role in the underlying genetic architecture for breast cancer.
title: Potential Misrepresentation of Inherited Breast Cancer Risk by Common Germline Alleles

finding: The SNP rs591592 demonstrated a positive association with angina risk, indicated by an odds ratio (OR_IVW) of 1.005 and a 95% confidence interval (CI) of 1.003–1.007, p < 0.001, implicating its role in cardiovascular disease progression.
title: Causality of Genetically Determined Monounsaturated Fatty Acids on Risk of Cardiovascular Disease: A Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: The rs2334499 variant was linked to PoO specific associations with type 2 diabetes, demonstrating that the paternal allele increased risk while the maternal allele decreased risk, consistent with previous findings from the Icelandic population.
title: Genome-wide survey of parent-of-origin specific associations across clinical traits derived from electronic health records

finding: The variant rs35723406 in the TKFC gene near the FADS1-2-3 region exhibited effect heterogeneity between men and women for the Δ6 desaturase lipid index in TAG (D6D in TAG), showing significant sex differences in its association with lipid metabolism, specifically indicating potential areas for further investigation.
title: Lipidome- and genome-wide study to understand sex differences in circulatory lipids

finding: This intronic SNP located in NRXN2 was identified as significant in a SNP-by-sex interaction analysis, showcasing a strong association with latent cardiac phenotypes. It had a P-value of 1.34 × 10^-11 and was implicated as an eQTL for VEGFB, hinting at its potential role in cardiovascular development.
title: Unsupervised cardiac MRI phenotyping with 3D diffusion autoencoders reveals novel genetic insights

finding: The SNP rs3781637 was noted for its significant association with GDM. Ancient DNA analysis revealed this variant's origin in an ancient Chinese individual over 10,000 years ago, and it showed a higher frequency in East Asian populations compared to Europeans.
title: Genetic studies of gestational diabetes mellitus in 21,813 Chinese women

finding: The variant rs12225378 was found to have a significant association with GDM risk. Its analysis further contributed to understanding the genetic differentiation of GDM between different populations.
title: Genetic studies of gestational diabetes mellitus in 21,813 Chinese women

finding: The SNP rs530537 in the <italic>CASP1</italic> gene exhibited a significant association with gastric cancer, with an adjusted odds ratio of 1.23 (p = 0.019). This suggests a role for the inflammatory processes mediated by <italic>CASP1</italic> in the risk of gastric adenocarcinoma.
title: Ornithine Decarboxylase (ODC1) gene variant (rs2302615) is associated with gastric cancer independently of Helicobacter pylori CagA serostatus

finding: The variant rs174535 located within the FADS locus showed a significant interaction with dietary long-chain omega-3 fatty acid intake (dN3FA) in its effect on plasma N3 fatty acid levels (pN3FA) and subsequent chronic inflammation as measured by high sensitivity CRP (hsCRP). The interaction achieved a p-value of 1.6x10^-12 in the upstream analysis, highlighting its relevance in the genetic modification of the dN3FA-hsCRP pathway. In contrast, there was no interaction signal found in the downstream analysis with a p-value of 0.94, nor was there a significant finding in the standard analysis (p = 0.097), illustrating the importance of the upstream interaction analysis. This suggests that the interaction and genetic influence of rs174535 on the dN3FA and plasma fatty acid relationship might have been undetected if only traditional methods were applied.
title: Decomposed interaction testing improves detection of genetic modifiers of the relationship of dietary omega-3 fatty acid intake and its plasma biomarkers with hsCRP in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs35705950, located in the MUC5B gene, demonstrated a strong association with IPF risk, with an odds ratio (OR) of 3.85 (95% CI: 3.24-4.47; p < 0.05). It was supported by fifteen studies, primarily in European subjects. High expression of MUC5B was linked to increased mucus production and subsequent lung inflammation, leading to IPF progression.
title: Genetic landscape of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis: A systematic review, meta-analysis and epidemiological evidence of case-control studies

finding: The lncRNA NEAT1 variant rs595366 was associated with elevated serum ALT levels and showed eQTL effects for NEAT1 in both adipose and liver tissues, indicating its relevance in liver metabolism.
title: Somatically mutated genes in fatty liver disease have minimal influence on germline risk

finding: Variants in NEAT1, such as rs34743766, were associated with HbA1c levels (beta=0.1, p=8.5×10^-9), suggesting a potential link between this locus and glucose metabolism.
title: Somatically mutated genes in fatty liver disease have minimal influence on germline risk

finding: This SNP was part of the locus RP11-856F16.2 and showed a significant association with early childhood caries (ECC) in a GWAS, with the statistical analysis being replicated in the GLIDE consortium adult cohort (EAF[A]: 0.53, P=0.03) and GLIDE pediatric cohort (EAF[T]: 0.06, P=0.01).
title: Multi-ancestry Genome-Wide Association Study of Early Childhood Caries

finding: The SNP rs6589386 was identified as a convergent lead SNP with strong associations for both AUD and SCZ. It had a cross-disorder p-value of 5.7e-18, an AUD p-value of 7.1e-12, and an SCZ p-value of 1.6e-8. This SNP was also recognized as an eQTL for the gene DRD2 in cerebellar hemisphere tissue, indicating its relevance in both disorders as informed by multiple GWAS.
title: Investigation of convergent and divergent genetic influences underlying schizophrenia and alcohol use disorder

finding: The finding indicated that the Val66Met polymorphism (rs6265) was associated with greater neuromodulatory effects in rTMS responses. Specifically, 52.2% of the rTMS protocols showed that Val/Val homozygotes demonstrated superior behavioral and neurophysiological responses compared to Met allele carriers, indicating that individuals with the Val66Val genotype had more reliable neuromodulatory effects when subjected to rTMS.
title: The Impact of Brain-Derived Neurotrophic Factor Polymorphism and Stimulation Parameters on the Response to Repetitive Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation: A Systematic Review

finding: The FADS2 Indel I allele identified people who showed a significant reduction in colorectal polyp number by approximately 50% when using eicosapentaenoic acid (EPA), contrastingly, no interaction was observed with aspirin. This finding was based on 528 trial participants from the seAFOod polyp prevention trial who had undergone colonoscopy and genetic testing for the FADS2 Indel genotype.
title: FADS2 Indel polymorphism rs66698963 predicts colorectal polyp prevention by the n-3 fatty acid EPA

finding: The SNP rs11020245 was linked to KCNMA1 expression, which was found to be downregulated in colorectal cancer through epigenetic mechanisms. This indicated a potential regulatory effect of this SNP in cancer biology.
title: Identification of Key Genes and Signaling Pathways Associated with the Progression of Glioblastoma multiform

finding: The SNP rs732934 was identified as a gene-sex interaction variant that influenced serum 25-hydroxy vitamin D (25OHD) levels. The effect allele was associated with a -2.04 nmol/L decrease in females and a -2.79 nmol/L decrease in males. This variant was known to be an eQTL and sQTL for DHCR7 in both sun-exposed and not-sun-exposed skin tissues, suggesting differential expression effects based on sex.
title: Improved characterization of gene-environment interactions for vitamin D through variance quantitative trait loci

finding: The SNP rs12794714 was noted for significant interaction effects between genetic variation and BMI, describing a weakening of genetic effects with increased BMI, indicating its role in modulating vitamin D status.
title: Improved characterization of gene-environment interactions for vitamin D through variance quantitative trait loci

finding: The SNP rs61147618 demonstrated interaction effects with adiposity measures indicating its role in the genetics of vitamin D concentrations influencing how body composition affected these levels.
title: Improved characterization of gene-environment interactions for vitamin D through variance quantitative trait loci

finding: This SNP located in the ATM gene not only presented with mLOX susceptibility but also had associations with breast cancer pointing to a potential neoplastic link.
title: Population analyses of mosaic X chromosome loss identify genetic drivers and widespread signatures of cellular selection

finding: The SNP rs6265, specifically the G196A variant located in the BDNF gene promoter, was found to lead to a change in the amino acid sequence at codon 66 (Val66Met). This variant was previously linked to a deficit in BDNF release and a reduction in the efficiency of BDNF-TrkB signaling, which is crucial for memory and long-term potentiation (LTP). The significance of this finding was highlighted in the context of the study's focus on neuroplasticity and aging, suggesting that genetic factors like rs6265 could influence BDNF levels and thereby impact brain health.
title: The MultiMusic multidomain intervention including choral practice in community-dwelling older people: A study protocol for Brain-Derived Neurotrophic Factor (BDNF) salivary biomarkers, audiometric and neuropsychological parameters

finding: Identified as a European ancestry-specific variant in the FOLH1 gene, rs181802264 showed a large effect size (OR = 11.39) and a P-value of 2.00 × 10^-8, marking it as a crucial genetic risk factor for high myopia (HM) within that ancestry.
title: Sequencing of 19,219 exomes identifies a low-frequency variant in FKBP5 promoter predisposing to high myopia in a Han Chinese population

finding: The G allele of rs4753834 was associated with a lower risk of having somatic mutations in ATM and increased expression of the ATM gene in non-cancerous tissues.
title: Germline cancer gene expression quantitative trait loci influence local and global tumor mutations

finding: This stably linked SNP was associated with TMB in non-small cell lung cancer and indicated a lower risk of mutation in the ATM gene.
title: Germline cancer gene expression quantitative trait loci influence local and global tumor mutations

finding: The SNP rs5072, situated in the intron of the APOA1-AS gene, was associated with early-onset AMI (odds ratio = 1.545, p-value = 8.61 × 10^-6). This gene is involved in lipid metabolism, affecting the regulation of apolipoprotein A1, a key component of HDL cholesterol.
title: Genome-wide analyses of early-onset acute myocardial infarction identify 29 novel loci by whole genome sequencing

finding: The SNP rs6277, located in the DRD2 gene, was identified as the only susceptibility factor for schizophrenia in a case-control association study within the Bulgarian population. This finding highlights the significance of the DRD2 gene in understanding the genetic factors contributing to schizophrenia.
title: DRAGON-Data: A platform and protocol for integrating genomic and phenotypic data across large psychiatric cohorts

finding: The rs77750788 variant positioned near IGSF9B was linked with an increased risk of HNC, evidencing an odds ratio of 2.07 (95% CI: 1.61, 2.68, p_meta=2.03×10^-8).
title: Cross-ancestral GWAS identifies 29 novel variants across Head and Neck Cancer subsites

finding: The intronic variant rs181194133 in OPCML was associated with increased risk of HNC, with an odds ratio of 3.44 (95% CI: 2.24, 5.31, p_meta=2.09×10^-8).
title: Cross-ancestral GWAS identifies 29 novel variants across Head and Neck Cancer subsites

finding: This variant was associated with increased risk of head and neck cancers in European populations.
title: Cross-ancestral GWAS identifies 29 novel variants across Head and Neck Cancer subsites

finding: The rs35705950 promoter polymorphism located in the MUC5B gene was well known to be associated with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF). In the context of interstitial lung abnormalities (ILA), it was identified as one of the four genome-wide significant variants from a GWAS of ILA. This suggested a potential link between this SNP and both IPF and ILA, highlighting the significance of MUC5B in these lung conditions.
title: Blood Gene Expression Risk Profiles and Interstitial Lung Abnormalities: COPDGene and ECLIPSE cohort studies

finding: SNP rs1940701 was identified as one of the most significant loci associated with all four substance use traits (OUD, CUD, AUD, SMK) and located in intronic regions of NCAM1.
title: Multi-trait Analysis of GWAS (MTAG) of Substance Use Traits Identifies Novel Genetic Loci and Phenomic Associations

finding: SNP rs4479020 was another intronic variant associated with all four substance use traits, being in complete LD with rs1940701.
title: Multi-trait Analysis of GWAS (MTAG) of Substance Use Traits Identifies Novel Genetic Loci and Phenomic Associations

finding: SNP rs7110786 was an intronic variant in MTMR2, identified as a novel GWS locus with no prior associations found.
title: Multi-trait Analysis of GWAS (MTAG) of Substance Use Traits Identifies Novel Genetic Loci and Phenomic Associations

finding: SNP rs12360992 was an intronic variant in ANKK1 associated with AUD trait.
title: Multi-trait Analysis of GWAS (MTAG) of Substance Use Traits Identifies Novel Genetic Loci and Phenomic Associations

finding: SNP rs2686880 was an intronic variant in CNOT4 associated with multiple substance use traits.
title: Multi-trait Analysis of GWAS (MTAG) of Substance Use Traits Identifies Novel Genetic Loci and Phenomic Associations

finding: The variant rs174570 was shared by five of the eleven fatty acids associated with the FADS locus, indicating its pleiotropic effects on multiple metabolite traits.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals shared and distinct genetic architecture underlying fatty acid and bioactive oxylipin metabolites in the Hispanic Community Health Study/Study of Latinos (HCHS/SOL)

finding: The FADS variant rs174564 was reported to explain 9.4% of the trait variance for arachidonic acid, highlighting its significant role in the metabolism of this fatty acid.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals shared and distinct genetic architecture underlying fatty acid and bioactive oxylipin metabolites in the Hispanic Community Health Study/Study of Latinos (HCHS/SOL)

finding: The study found a cluster-specific enrichment of the diabetes-related genetic variant rs10830963 in MTNR1B. Participants in cluster 3 exhibited a higher frequency of the diabetes-associated G allele compared to those in cluster 1, indicating a significant association with increased glycemia. The differences in frequency were statistically significant with an uncorrected p-value of 0.00036 for cluster 3 relative to cluster 1. Moreover, the analysis identified significant differences within the beta-cell group in terms of diabetes-related genetic variants, with uncorrected p-values of 0.001 and 0.007 after Benjamini-Hochberg correction, thereby demonstrating that rs10830963 was relevant to the pathophysiological classification of those at increased risk for type 2 diabetes.
title: Pathophysiology-based subphenotyping of individuals at elevated risk for type 2 diabetes

finding: Similar to rs143821594, rs4930642 was recognized as an outlier in the Mendelian randomization analysis, yet its removal led to consistent results indicating a causal link between SLE and CHF. The findings suggested that genetic predisposition to SLE was significantly correlated with a higher risk of CHF, demonstrated by an odds ratio of 1.032 (95% CI 1.004–1.061, P=0.023).
title: The potential causal association of systemic lupus erythematosus with congestive heart failure in the East Asian population: A two-sample Mendelian randomization study

finding: The A528T substitution was the most common SORL1 variant, carried by 3.6% of individuals in the sample, and was associated with a small 1.11-fold increased risk of Alzheimer's disease (AD) in the GWAS (p=5.79×10^-8). However, the age at onset for carriers of this variant fully overlapped with carriers of the wild-type SORL1.
title: Effect of prioritized SORL1 missense variants supports clinical consideration for familial Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The D2065V substitution in the 3Fn domain was carried by 0.46% of the sample and was associated with a 1.36-fold increased risk of AD (p=1.61×10^-6) in the GWAS. However, the findings did not provide evidence that any of the other non-rare variants in the sample, including this one, associates with altered risk of AD.
title: Effect of prioritized SORL1 missense variants supports clinical consideration for familial Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs3200401 was associated with an increased expression of the lincRNA MALAT1 with the risk allele C in osteoarthritis (OA) cartilage, exhibiting a meta-φ value of 0.54.
title: Allelic expression imbalance in articular cartilage and subchondral bone refined genome-wide association signals in osteoarthritis

finding: The SNP rs2514895 was found to be associated with paliperidone-induced LDL changes, achieving genome-wide significance (p = 4.96e-09, FDR = 0.004). It is located near the KIRREL3 gene, which has a role in neuronal function.
title: Pharmacogenetic Study of Antipsychotic-Induced Lipid and BMI Changes in Chinese Schizophrenia Patients: A Genome-Wide Association Study

finding: The rs140226575 variant, which leads to the Thr370Met amino acid change in the ARRB1 gene, was associated with a greater reduction in HbA1c levels. Specifically, each copy of the Methionine was linked to a reduction of 2.7 mmol/mol (p=5.2×10^-06). This variant's effects were particularly pronounced in populations with higher frequencies of the allele, revealing its contribution to inter-individual variability in response to GLP-1RA.
title: Pharmacogenomics of GLP-1 Receptor Agonists: A genome wide analysis of observational data and large randomized controlled trials

finding: The SNP rs11228623 was identified as a lead variant at the novel significant locus 11q12 associated with olfactory dysfunction. It was linked to 71 phenotypes, including lymphocyte counts and cardiovascular health indicators, providing evidence of causal relationships between olfactory dysfunction and various health outcomes.
title: Genome-Wide Association Study Meta-Analysis Uncovers Novel Genetic Variants Associated with Olfactory Dysfunction

finding: The SNP rs12786376 was confirmed as an independent significant SNP associated with olfactory dysfunction. Its association remained consistent in multi-ancestry analyses, and it was linked to the gene SLC43A3, which showed a borderline significant interaction with age regarding olfactory function.
title: Genome-Wide Association Study Meta-Analysis Uncovers Novel Genetic Variants Associated with Olfactory Dysfunction

finding: The SNP rs12225548 in the TREH locus was involved in gene-gene interactions with rs281379 in the FUT2 locus and rs635634 in the ABO locus, showing associations with alkaline phosphatase levels.
title: Hypothesis-free detection of gene-interaction effects on biomarker concentration in UK Biobank using variance prioritisation

finding: The SNP rs28413939 in the TREH locus was a part of the identified vQTLs but specific details about its effects were not attributed to a particular phenotype.
title: Hypothesis-free detection of gene-interaction effects on biomarker concentration in UK Biobank using variance prioritisation

finding: The SNP rs964184 in the APOA5 locus was included among the prioritised vQTLs based on its association with gene expression.
title: Hypothesis-free detection of gene-interaction effects on biomarker concentration in UK Biobank using variance prioritisation

finding: For the variant rs2074227, it colocalized with CD6 protein levels and all-stroke genetic associations, indicating a shared causal variant underpinning both the protein levels and stroke outcomes.
title: Genetically predicted levels of the human plasma proteome and risk of stroke: a Mendelian Randomization study

finding: The index variant rs174551 was located in the 5-UTR of the FADS1 and FADS2 genes at region 11q12.2. It displayed a significant p-value of 6.92×10^-50, highlighting its role in the genetic risk for heart failure related to lipid metabolism.
title: Exploring novel risk loci for heart failure and the shared genetic etiology with blood lipids, blood pressure, and blood glucose: a large-scale multi-trait association analysis

finding: The variant rs34312154 was reported in region 11p11.2, exhibiting the highest CADD score of 31, indicating a potentially deleterious effect. It had a p-value of 3.38×10^-09, confirming its association with conditions leading to heart failure.
title: Exploring novel risk loci for heart failure and the shared genetic etiology with blood lipids, blood pressure, and blood glucose: a large-scale multi-trait association analysis

finding: The SNP rs149261869 was significantly associated with the risk of ischemic stroke in the subgroup randomized to low-dose vitamin supplementation, with a P-value of 5.6×10−5. This finding was part of a larger analysis that included gene-based tests for genetic variation related to ischemic stroke.
title: Whole Exome Sequencing Analyses Support a Role of Vitamin D Metabolism in Ischemic Stroke

finding: The SNP rs117335120 was significantly associated with the risk of ischemic stroke in the subgroup randomized to low-dose vitamin supplementation, with a P-value of 9.2×10−5. This finding was part of the ongoing investigations into the genetic determinants of stroke risks.
title: Whole Exome Sequencing Analyses Support a Role of Vitamin D Metabolism in Ischemic Stroke

finding: The APOC3 rs138326449 variant, a donor loss variant, was evaluated in the context of Mendelian randomization. Findings indicated that genetically lowered APOC3 levels were linked to a reduced risk of coronary artery disease (CAD), with an odds ratio of 0.90 per standard deviation of protein level, thus suggesting an important protective effect against CAD.
title: Drug-target Mendelian randomization analysis supports lowering plasma ANGPTL3, ANGPTL4, and APOC3 levels as strategies for reducing cardiovascular disease risk

finding: The SNP rs11040550 was associated with the timing of adjuvant chemotherapy and its survival outcomes in colorectal cancer as reported by Petrelli et al. in their systematic review and meta-analysis. The study emphasized the critical time window for chemotherapy administration and its direct impact on patient survival rates.
title: The impact of lag time to cancer diagnosis and treatment on clinical outcomes prior to the COVID-19 pandemic: a scoping review of systematic reviews and meta-analyses

finding: The SNP rs615540, linked to the CCDC88B gene, was identified as a novel locus contributing to PMR risk.
title: Modifiable risk factors and inflammation-related proteins in polymyalgia rheumatica: genome-wide meta-analysis and Mendelian randomisation

finding: The intronic rs10896164 variant near the ADRBK1 gene demonstrated a significant association with OA across multiple ancestry groups in MVP, suggesting a widespread genetic influence on OA pain sensitivity.
title: Novel Genetic Loci Associated with Osteoarthritis in Multi-Ancestry Analyses in 484,374 Participants from MVP and the UK Biobank

finding: The variant rs2524296 was located in the 11q12.2 locus near the FADS1 gene. It was identified as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) influencing the expression of FADS1 in the left lung and had a putative regulatory role over four other genes, showing that it played a significant role in lung cancer predisposition.
title: Machine learning-based proteogenomic data modeling identifies circulating plasma biomarkers for early detection of lung cancer

finding: The SNP rs4937515 demonstrated shared genetic influences with cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) volume, showing a posterior probability of PPH4 = 0.997. This association suggested a strong genetic link underlying the connection between retinal imaging biomarkers and brain structure, particularly relevant to understanding glaucoma.
title: Eye-brain connections revealed by multimodal retinal and brain imaging genetics in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs4936099 was linked to cerebrospinal fluid volume, with a significant genetic overlap observed, further underscoring the connection between retinal structures and brain disorders.
title: Eye-brain connections revealed by multimodal retinal and brain imaging genetics in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs12807936 exhibited shared genetic influences between retinal imaging traits and connectivity within the auditory network, with a high posterior probability (PPH4 = 0.994), suggesting a unique association with neuropsychiatric attributes.
title: Eye-brain connections revealed by multimodal retinal and brain imaging genetics in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs2875238 was in linkage disequilibrium with known genetic risk variants of glaucoma, underscoring the interplay between retinal disease and genetic risk factors.
title: Eye-brain connections revealed by multimodal retinal and brain imaging genetics in the UK Biobank

finding: The rs59039403 variant in the NLRP10 locus exhibited a PIP of 1 and displayed significant allele frequency differences between East Asian populations (12.4%) and European populations (<0.1%). This provided evidence for its role as a causal variant in the genetic architecture underlying atopic dermatitis.
title: Multi-ancestry Genome-Wide Association Meta-Analysis Identifies Novel Loci in Atopic Dermatitis

finding: The eQTL variant rs12785905 was associated with prostate cancers, exhibiting a frequency of 0.06 in UKB-EUR as opposed to 0.006 in UKB-AFR, illustrating a significant population frequency difference.
title: Mapping Epigenetic Gene Variant Dynamics: Comparative Analysis of Frequency, Functional Impact and Trait Associations in African and European Populations

finding: The rs12575252 variant in TRIM66 was associated with waist-hip measurements, showing a higher frequency in UKB-AFR (0.54) than in UKB-EUR (0.35, p = 1.4 x 10^-194), indicating relevance to body size traits.
title: Mapping Epigenetic Gene Variant Dynamics: Comparative Analysis of Frequency, Functional Impact and Trait Associations in African and European Populations

finding: Similarly, rs56088284 exhibited significant frequency differences and associations with traits particular to UKB-EUR populations.
title: Mapping Epigenetic Gene Variant Dynamics: Comparative Analysis of Frequency, Functional Impact and Trait Associations in African and European Populations

finding: The eQTL rs12785906 was part of the cluster associated with IGF-1 levels, exhibiting significant frequency differences favoring UKB-EUR.
title: Mapping Epigenetic Gene Variant Dynamics: Comparative Analysis of Frequency, Functional Impact and Trait Associations in African and European Populations

finding: The rs2236682 variant was associated with creatinine levels and showed considerable frequency variation across different African populations.
title: Mapping Epigenetic Gene Variant Dynamics: Comparative Analysis of Frequency, Functional Impact and Trait Associations in African and European Populations

finding: It was associated with TRIM66 gene expression and noted as one of the loci influencing immune-related traits in the context of T1D, suggesting its involvement in the disease mechanism.
title: Genetic factors affecting immune phenotypes in type 1 diabetes

finding: This SNP was indicated to influence immune response parameters through its regulatory effects on immune gene expression, marking it as a significant finding in the context of T1D.
title: Genetic factors affecting immune phenotypes in type 1 diabetes

finding: Variant rs1954787 was linked with GRIK4 and presented a noteworthy allele frequency difference of 0.229 between European and Asian groups, further illustrating the genetic diversity pertinent to pharmacogenomics.
title: Diversity and level of evidence evaluation of commercial pharmacogenomic testing for mental health

finding: The SNP rs1940701 was identified as the leading SNP in the most significant locus located in NCAM1 on chromosome 11. It was associated with TBI cases in the study involving 304,485 veterans.
title: Genome-wide Association Study of Traumatic Brain Injury in U.S. Military Veterans Enrolled in the VA Million Veteran Program

finding: At the INS locus, fine-mapping identified this variant as likely causal with a high PIP of 0.96, indicating its significant role in the risk of T1D.
title: Genetic association and machine learning improves discovery and prediction of type 1 diabetes

finding: Also at the INS locus, this variant was resolved as a likely causal variant with a PIP of 0.99, contributing to the increased risk of T1D.
title: Genetic association and machine learning improves discovery and prediction of type 1 diabetes

finding: At the INS locus, this variant was outcompeted by rs689, indicating lower causal probability igniting discussions about variant roles in T1D.
title: Genetic association and machine learning improves discovery and prediction of type 1 diabetes

finding: This SNP was categorized as exonic and part of the novel loci associated with anxiety, although specific functional details regarding its role within the SERGEF gene were not provided.
title: Identification of Novel Genomic Loci for Anxiety and Extensive Genetic Overlap with Psychiatric Disorders

finding: This SNP was noted as shared between anxiety and ADHD, contributing to the understanding of the genetic architecture underlying both conditions.
title: Identification of Novel Genomic Loci for Anxiety and Extensive Genetic Overlap with Psychiatric Disorders

finding: The missense variant rs11549690 in TRPT1, with a CADD score of 19.8, was found to be potentially implicated in bipolar disorder.
title: Fine-mapping genomic loci refines bipolar disorder risk genes

finding: The SNP rs2510682 was noted as the most significant novel cross-ancestry locus for anxiety, situated within the intronic region of the CNTN5 gene. It had a cross-ancestry z-score of 5.92 and a p-value of 3.3×10^-9, though it mainly reflected the influence from European samples.
title: Gene Discovery and Biological Insights into Anxiety Disorders from a Multi-Ancestry Genome-wide Association Study of >1.2 Million Participants

finding: The rs8177398 SNP from the TIRAP locus was significantly associated with Endoglin levels, yielding a p-value of 8.82 x 10^-11 and was noted to show suggestive evidence for association with venous thrombosis.
title: Non-canonical regulation of Endoglin by rare and common variants: new molecular and clinical perspectives for Hereditary Hemorrhagic Telangiectasia and beyond

finding: The variant rs3842724, located in exon 14 of the Tyrosine Hydroxylase gene (TH), was significantly associated with increased plasma OT levels (β = 1.14, p-value 4.98 × 10^-6). This finding was particularly important in the context of dopamine synthesis and its interaction with oxytocin signaling.
title: Genetic and epigenetic signatures associated with plasma oxytocin levels in children and adolescents with autism spectrum disorder

finding: SNP rs12794714 showed evidence as an outlier related to the risk of hypertension in Mendelian randomization analyses. However, once this outlier was removed from the dataset, the causal association was consistent with null findings regarding serum 25(OH)D and hypertension risk.
title: Investigating the relationship of serum vitamin D levels with blood pressure and hypertension risk in The HUNT Study: Using traditional observational and Mendelian randomization approaches

finding: SNP rs11040813 was identified as having significant pleiotropic effects between depression and gastro-oesophageal reflux disease (GORD). It surpassed the Bonferroni-corrected threshold, indicating a likely causal relationship between the two conditions. The SNP is located in region 11p15.4, near the gene CNGA4.
title: Phenomic Network Analysis for Depression Reveals Comorbidity Architecture, Genomic Relationships, and Pleiotropic Variants

finding: The SNP rs9919558 was significantly associated with externalizing phenotypes in the EXT GWAS, demonstrating a strong genetic connection with alcohol-related traits. It was part of a locus on chromosome 11, which was notably linked to alcohol metabolism-related genes.
title: Parsing Genetically Influenced Risk Pathways: Genetic Loci Impact Problematic Alcohol Use Via Externalizing and Specific Risk

finding: This SNP was linked to fractures (fractured or broken bones in the last 5 years), demonstrating significant implications for understanding the pathways connecting TBS and fracture risk.
title: Genetic Determinants of Bone Microarchitecture and its Association with Health Outcomes: A Genome-wide Association and Mendelian Randomization Study on Trabecular Bone Score

finding: The rs2884183 SNP (located at 11q22.3, within the DDX10 gene) was associated with decreased risk for Alzheimer's disease (AD), independent of the APOE ε2 allele.
title: Inter- and intra-chromosomal modulators of the APOE ε2 and ε4 effects on the Alzheimer’s disease risk

finding: This SNP in ODF3 was linked to multiple conditions, including uterine leiomyoma, benign meningeal tumours, and polyps in the female genital tract, providing new associations beyond established prostate hyperplasia.
title: Genetic associations of protein-coding variants in human disease

finding: This SNP was also identified by both IBI and GWAS as significant for hypertension, reflecting its critical role in the genomic variations related to HTN.
title: An individualized Bayesian method for estimating genomic variants of hypertension

finding: This SNP in the GRIK4 loci was recognized in the IBI analysis, underscoring its potential contributions to hypertension traits.
title: An individualized Bayesian method for estimating genomic variants of hypertension

finding: The SNP rs174547 was mentioned as an intronic variant of the gene FADS1, which plays a role in the interaction with HDL cholesterol levels. The study noted its complex relationship with HDL levels, highlighting that dietary intake of linoleic acid could influence this interaction. This finding was significant in the context of causal feedback loops relating FADS1 to HDL cholesterol, further confirming the importance of this SNP in understanding lipid metabolism.
title: Differentially expressed genes reflect disease-induced rather than disease-causing changes in the transcriptome

finding: The SNP rs174564, located in the FADS2 gene, was associated with the lipid species PC(18:0_20:4) with a very strong significance (P=4.63×10−220). This finding demonstrated a clear relationship between the genetic variant and lipid metabolism, which may be relevant to coronary artery disease (CAD).
title: Comprehensive genetic analysis of the human lipidome identifies novel loci controlling lipid homeostasis with links to coronary artery disease

finding: The SNP rs174601, located on chromosome 11 near the FADS1 gene, was identified as significant in the context of bipolar disorder (BD) versus major depressive disorder (MDD) analysis. It presented a genome-wide significant association with BD (P = 8.0e-10) and showed a notable odds ratio (OR of 0.99 overall). In comparative analyses, the effect size was more pronounced: OR of 0.93 for the BD vs MDD GWAS and OR of 0.89 for meta-regression, indicating a strong genetic correlation and supporting the notion of BD having a distinct genetic profile relative to MDD. While a trend was observed for MDD, the association was not statistically significant (P > 0.1). This finding underscored the genetic distinctions between these disorders.
title: Identifying genetic differences between bipolar disorder and major depression through multiple GWAS

finding: rs36020612 was associated with antibodies against T. gondii at the ALSPAC seven-year clinic (P = 1.2×10^-12, β = 0.20). This relationship persisted at later clinical time-points, showing effect sizes of β = 0.20 at the 11-year clinic and β = 0.21 at the 15-year clinic. However, this association did not replicate in the UK Biobank with P > 5.9×10^-4.
title: Genetic analyses of common infections in the Avon Longitudinal Study of Parents and Children cohort

finding: There was a notable discovery at the MS4A6A locus where rs1151105 was identified as an MPRA-active variant that showed transcriptional activity specifically in proinflammatory macrophages. This variant exhibited higher enhancer activity compared to the GWAS lead variant rs7935829.
title: Deciphering the functional impact of Alzheimer’s Disease-associated variants in resting and proinflammatory immune cells

finding: This SNP was found to be associated with LRP4, a protein highlighted as a candidate for therapeutic intervention in myocardial infarction.
title: Proteome-wide Mendelian Randomization Analysis Identified Potential Drug Targets for Myocardial Infarction

finding: This SNP was also linked to LRP4, corroborating its potential role in MI risk.
title: Proteome-wide Mendelian Randomization Analysis Identified Potential Drug Targets for Myocardial Infarction

finding: This SNP was linked to Apo C-III, which was identified in the study as a promising candidate for MI therapeutic targets.
title: Proteome-wide Mendelian Randomization Analysis Identified Potential Drug Targets for Myocardial Infarction

finding: This SNP was associated with SWAP70 when the threshold was lowered, indicating its potential relevance in the context of MI.
title: Proteome-wide Mendelian Randomization Analysis Identified Potential Drug Targets for Myocardial Infarction

finding: This SNP was also linked to SWAP70, further supporting the protein's potential drug target status for myocardial infarction.
title: Proteome-wide Mendelian Randomization Analysis Identified Potential Drug Targets for Myocardial Infarction

finding: This SNP was additionally found to associate with SWAP70, which was noted for its potential in MI risk management.
title: Proteome-wide Mendelian Randomization Analysis Identified Potential Drug Targets for Myocardial Infarction

finding: This SNP was part of the SWAP70 associations, underscoring the protein's significance as a potential drug target for myocardial infarction.
title: Proteome-wide Mendelian Randomization Analysis Identified Potential Drug Targets for Myocardial Infarction

finding: The variant rs79478137 was associated with WHRadjBMI in women, showing genome-wide significance with a meta-analysis p-value of 3.64×10−9. It was intronic to SLC22A18AS and is known to show genomic imprinting, linked to growth disorders.
title: Genome-wide association study of body fat distribution traits in Hispanics/Latinos from the HCHS/SOL Study

finding: The SNP rs3168072 was significantly associated with waist circumference adjusted for BMI (WCadjBMI) after combining results with an independent European American sample, appearing to influence multiple lipid-related metabolites.
title: Genome-wide association study of body fat distribution traits in Hispanics/Latinos from the HCHS/SOL Study

finding: The variant rs200755764 on chromosome 11 was associated with FEV1 decline; however, it exhibited an opposite effect direction between the discovery and replication analyses.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide association study reveals novel genetic signals for lung function decline

finding: The SNP rs10792832 was identified as an AD risk variant located within an Open Chromatin Region (OCR). It was associated with both lower OCR signal and reduced gene expression, indicating that the risk allele correlated with increased Alzheimer's disease risk through decreased accessibility and transcriptional activity of the PICALM gene, a well-supported gene in Alzheimer's disease.
title: Genetics of the human microglia regulome refines Alzheimer’s disease risk loci

finding: The finding indicated that carriers of the Val66Val genotype showed less aphasia severity compared to Met allele carriers, with this association remaining significant when controlling for lesion volume and time post-stroke. These results suggested that the BDNF polymorphism (rs6265) contributed to variability in post-stroke language recovery and interacted with neurophysiological indicators like cortical excitability and stimulation-induced neuroplasticity to improve predictions of aphasia severity.
title: Genetic and neurophysiological biomarkers of neuroplasticity inform post-stroke language recovery

finding: The missense variant rs201870990 in ANO1 was associated with ascending aorta dimensions, displaying effects of 41.95 mm² (P = 7.6 × 10^-11 for maximum area) and 42.05 mm² (P = 1.4 × 10^-11 for minimum area). This confirmed previous GWAS findings and highlighted ANO1's potential role in cardiac structural integrity.
title: Mapping rare protein-coding variants on multi-organ imaging traits

finding: The SNP rs12252 was involved in the frequency of a combined IFITM3 haplotype that correlated with the standardized mortality ratio of ethnic groups in England, suggesting a potential association with COVID-19 severity.
title: Host genome analysis of structural variations by Optical Genome Mapping provides clinically valuable insights into genes implicated in critical immune, viral infection, and viral replication pathways in patients with severe COVID-19

finding: The SNP rs34481144 was part of the same combined IFITM3 haplotype as rs12252, indicating its contribution to the observed correlation with COVID-19 mortality across different ethnic groups in England.
title: Host genome analysis of structural variations by Optical Genome Mapping provides clinically valuable insights into genes implicated in critical immune, viral infection, and viral replication pathways in patients with severe COVID-19

finding: SuSiEx identified a credible set containing the missense variant rs11601507 associated with total bilirubin at a probability of inclusion (PIP) greater than 99%. Although it did not reach genome-wide significance in any population (P <sub>EUR</sub> = 1.9E-6, P <sub>AFR</sub> = 2.4E-2, P <sub>EAS</sub> = 1.1E-4), it had high causal probabilities of 0.998 in EUR, 0.743 in AFR, and 0.994 in EAS, indicating that it may be a common causal variant shared across these populations.
title: Fine-mapping across diverse ancestries drives the discovery of putative causal variants underlying human complex traits and diseases

finding: This SNP was used as a proxy for rs536995174 and showed consistent association with VTE across multiple cohorts during replication efforts.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS for venous thromboembolism identifies novel loci followed by experimental validation in zebrafish

finding: An intergenic variant that functioned as an eQTL for ARHGAP42, previously linked to blood pressure, pointing to its potential role in VTE.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS for venous thromboembolism identifies novel loci followed by experimental validation in zebrafish

finding: The SNP rs11212617, located at a locus including the ATM gene, was reproducibly associated with the glycaemic response to metformin in patients with type 2 diabetes. This finding contributed to understanding metformin's mechanism of action.
title: The Effect of Metformin Treatment on the Circulating Proteome

finding: The SNP rs4930561 was significantly associated with acute myeloid leukemia (AML) regardless of subtype, showing an odds ratio (OR) of 1.17 and a P-value of 2.15 × 10^-8. It mapped to the KMT5B gene on 11q13.2, indicating a potential role in the genetic risk for AML.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies susceptibility loci for acute myeloid leukemia

finding: A 1bp insertion found in exon 13 of IGHMBP2 was expected to cause a frameshift mutation in a proband diagnosed with Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease, demonstrating its potential pathogenicity.
title: Non-coding variants are a rare cause of recessive developmental disorders in trans with coding variants

finding: The intronic SNV 450bp from the splice donor site of exon 8 in IGHMBP2 was previously reported as a variant of uncertain significance but suggested leaky abnormal splicing. It was found in trans with a frameshift variant in a proband with CMT.
title: Non-coding variants are a rare cause of recessive developmental disorders in trans with coding variants

finding: The SNP rs35356320 was identified as a synonymous quantitative trait locus (QTL) for CD44 splicing. It was associated with the modulation of P. falciparum growth, suggesting its role in affecting the splicing and subsequent expression of the CD44 protein, which has been implicated in the parasite's ability to invade red blood cells.
title: Common host variation drives malaria parasite fitness in healthy human red cells

finding: The rs35705950 variant in the MUC5B promoter was related to idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF). This finding highlighted the importance of small airways in the pathogenesis of diseases, as it suggested a genetic predisposition to impaired mucociliary transport in respiratory conditions such as CF and IPF.
title: Mucociliary Clearance is Impaired in Small Airways of Cystic Fibrosis Pigs

finding: The rs3842753 C allele was associated with significantly higher insulin (INS) expression levels in pancreatic beta cells from donors, especially those with the A/C genotype, which exhibited the highest variance in expression. This finding was supported by the greater presence of ER stress marker gene expression, indicating an association with increased fragility and stress of beta cells related to inherited type 1 diabetes risk.
title: The type 1 diabetes at-risk allele at rs3842753 increases beta cell INS mRNA expression and variance in a meta-analysis of single cell RNA sequencing data

finding: Found at 11p11.2, this SNP showed robust linkage (z=5.71) to gene CD82, important for oligodendrocyte differentiation, marking a new entry in genetic influences on white matter.
title: Genetic architecture of the white matter connectome of the human brain

finding: The finding associated with rs28633403 demonstrated that it explained all of the signal at its loci, conditioned on the <italic>AP006621.5</italic> lead SNP with a GWAS P-value of 4.5E-07, leading to a conditioned GWAS P-value of 1. This finding indicated that the signal was originally attributed to this locus.
title: Transcriptome-wide association study of attention deficit hyperactivity disorder identifies associated genes and phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs11030356 was associated with functional roles related to the CEACAM1 isoform signature in NK cell-mediated killing in melanoma. This finding indicated that variations at this SNP could influence the efficacy of immune responses in melanoma, aligning with the broader context of immunotherapy effectiveness for cancer treatment.
title: A novel bioinformatics pipeline for the identification of immune inhibitory receptors as potential therapeutic targets

finding: The SNP rs1712814 showed a strong association with the hardness of boiled yam, underscoring its potential importance in enhancing culinary characteristics in breeding programs.
title: Detecting the genetic variants associated with key culinary traits in Dioscorea alata

finding: The Q5H variant (rs1138800) was identified as the most frequent missense variant in the human population, associated with a gain-of-function in Panx1 channels. This variant led to hyperactive channel properties, as demonstrated by increased mean peak conductance upon stimulation with the P2X7 receptor agonist compared to wild-type hPanx1.
title: Differential activation of mouse and human Panx1 channel variants

finding: The E390D variant (rs74549886) was shown to represent a loss-of-function mutation in Panx1. It was entirely insensitive to stimulation by the P2X7 receptor, leading to the conclusion that channels formed by this variant are functionally inactive.
title: Differential activation of mouse and human Panx1 channel variants

finding: The R217H variant (rs143240087) was reported to encode a nonfunctional channel and was associated with multisystem dysfunction, exhibiting a dominant-negative effect on Panx1 function.
title: Differential activation of mouse and human Panx1 channel variants

finding: The rs11568818 polymorphism was found to be associated with MMP-7 expression at an extra-articular site, as reported by Kazantseva and colleagues in 2013. This finding related to MMP expression in rheumatoid inflammation and highlighted genetic factors that may influence disease mechanisms and outcomes in rheumatoid arthritis.
title: Albumin-binding RNAi Conjugate for Carrier Free Treatment of Arthritis

finding: The SNP rs76779571 was associated with the infertility-linked mutant JunoH177Q, which was found in 9% of patients in a female idiopathic infertility cohort. Its prevalence was measured at 0.15–0.18% in populations with more than 150 Juno alleles sequenced. Despite showing a high binding affinity of KD = 64 ± 14 nM for Izumo1:JunoH177Q, the equilibrium and structural analysis of the Izumo1:Juno complex did not provide evidence for deleterious effects resulting from this mutation.
title: Force-dependent Reorganization and Mechanostability of the Izumo1:Juno Complex Involved in Human Fertilization

finding: The SNP rs10838629 was associated with wellbeing as found in a Genome-Wide Association Study (GWAS). This SNP related to the LDL receptor, specifically linked to LDL receptor-related protein 4 (LRP4), indicating a significant genetic factor influencing wellbeing.
title: The association between metabolite concentrations and wellbeing in adults

finding: The SNP rs61905145 was also found significant in Turley et al. (2018), being associated with Apolipoprotein A1 (APOA1). This further supported the connection between lipid metabolism and wellbeing in previous genetic studies.
title: The association between metabolite concentrations and wellbeing in adults

finding: The SNP rs11031006 was identified as being located 17 kb upstream of the Fshb gene and was linked to alterations in female fertility, including conditions such as endometriosis, longer menstrual cycles, spontaneous dizygotic twinning, and an increased risk of polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS). Functional investigations using CRISPR deletions in a murine gonadotrope cell line demonstrated that deletion of the TTATTT sequence in the regulatory region corresponding to this SNP led to increased expression of Fshb and enhanced secretion of FSH, thereby providing evidence of the SNP's regulatory role in the context of fertility-related phenotypes.
title: Single nucleus multi-omics regulatory atlas of the murine pituitary

finding: The SNP rs74771917 was reported as having extreme PBS values, indicating a strong signal of selection primarily among Native Americans, especially compared to both present-day Europeans (CEU) and East Asians (CHB). This finding was consistent even when using Mesolithic hunter-gatherers (HG) as an outgroup.
title: Limited evidence for selection at the FADS locus in Native American populations

finding: Similar to rs74771917, the SNP rs7115739 also exhibited extreme PBS values. This SNP's significance was maintained in the context of Native American populations, suggesting it is part of a selection signal distinct from the broader population comparisons with CEU and CHB.
title: Limited evidence for selection at the FADS locus in Native American populations

finding: This SNP was identified as having implications for bone mineral density, representing important findings linking genetics to phenotypic traits.
title: Genome-wide functional screen of 3’UTR variants uncovers causal variants for human disease and evolution

finding: This SNP was identified as part of a significant linkage group of variants near the ADAMTS8 gene for AAA. It had a p-value of 7.51x10^-9 and an odds ratio (OR) of 0.786, indicating a decrease in AAA prevalence in T allele homozygotes compared to other genotypes.
title: Analysis of UK Biobank Cohort Reveals Novel Insights for Thoracic and Abdominal Aortic Aneurysms

finding: Identified as part of a linkage group near ADAMTS8, this intronic SNP had a p-value range between 7.51x10^-9 to 1.59x10^-8, confirming its association with AAA.
title: Analysis of UK Biobank Cohort Reveals Novel Insights for Thoracic and Abdominal Aortic Aneurysms

finding: Another SNP within the ADAMTS8 linkage group for AAA with significant p-values from prior studies corroborating its role in aneurysm formation.
title: Analysis of UK Biobank Cohort Reveals Novel Insights for Thoracic and Abdominal Aortic Aneurysms

finding: This intronic variant in ADAMTS8 had p-values indicating a significant association with AAA prevalence, confirming its relevance in the disease through prior findings.
title: Analysis of UK Biobank Cohort Reveals Novel Insights for Thoracic and Abdominal Aortic Aneurysms

finding: The SNP rs1800497, which is a TaqI polymorphism in the DRD2 gene, was found to be associated with Posttraumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD). The study conducted by Hoxha et al. (2019) provided evidence suggesting that this SNP plays a significant role in the risk and manifestation of PTSD, highlighting its importance in understanding the genetic factors underlying this mental health condition.
title: Genome-wide characterization of human minisatellite VNTRs: population-specific alleles and gene expression differences

finding: The genetic polymorphism rs662799 in the APOA5-APOC3 locus was linked to coronary artery disease. In this study, TG 53:3 and TG 56:4 were positively associated with risk factors of cardiovascular disease, including hypertension and diabetes, identified through the analysis of 5,662 serum lipid profiles from a case-control study of first-ever acute myocardial infarction.
title: Allergic inflammation triggers dyslipidemia via IgG signalling

finding: The SNP rs983392 was reported as a trans-eQTL linked to a component containing 54 genes, with associations found to be significant for Alzheimer's disease. Its protective allele was associated with expression changes of trans-eGenes, indicating a role in disease susceptibility.
title: Tensor Decomposition of Stimulated Monocyte and Macrophage Gene Expression Profiles Identifies Neurodegenerative Disease-specific Trans-eQTLs

finding: At the TH locus, the rs4929965 A>G variant was located in a beta-cell specific open chromatin region that physically contacted the INS promoter over 12kb away, suggesting its critical role in gene regulation specific to beta cells.
title: The three-dimensional chromatin structure of the major human pancreatic cell types reveals lineage-specific regulatory architecture of T2D risk

finding: The rs7482891 A>G variant was part of chromatin interactions with target genes INS and TRPM5, demonstrating high contact frequency in beta cells, indicating its importance in the regulation of diabetes.
title: The three-dimensional chromatin structure of the major human pancreatic cell types reveals lineage-specific regulatory architecture of T2D risk

finding: Similar to rs4929965 and rs7482891, the rs4929964 T>G variant resided in a beta-cell specific open chromatin region and was predicted to disrupt transcription factor binding, implying its relevance in the regulatory mechanisms of T2D.
title: The three-dimensional chromatin structure of the major human pancreatic cell types reveals lineage-specific regulatory architecture of T2D risk

finding: The SNP rs11222084 had associations with two traits in opposite directions, particularly related to blood pressure.
title: Multivariate Genomewide Association Analysis with IHT
