title: Genome-wide association study and functional validation implicates JADE1 in tauopathy

finding: The SNP rs2081545 was associated with MS4A6A (p = 0.01) and adds to the evidence of genetic risk factors overlapping in PART.
title: Genome-wide association study and functional validation implicates JADE1 in tauopathy

finding: This SNP also showed an association with MS4A6A (p = 0.02), linking it to the pathogenesis of primary tauopathy.
title: Genome-wide association study and functional validation implicates JADE1 in tauopathy

finding: This SNP was shown to be involved in transcription start site utilization for <italic>PC</italic>, suggesting its role in obesity through different polypeptide products.
title: Epigenomic and transcriptomic prioritization of candidate obesity-risk regulatory GWAS SNPs

finding: The SNP rs549893, linked to hem production, was associated with tissue contrast in higher-order cortical areas and linked to disorders involving neurological complications and mitochondrial function.
title: Enhanced Brain Imaging Genetics in UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs11236797 was identified as a risk variant that possibly disrupts the establishment of specific enhancer complexes. This was inferred from the roles of STAT5 and GR in regulating Treg cell functions and the observations made in related studies on the enhancer capabilities of the region associated with the LRRC32 gene.
title: The transcription factor STAT5 binds to distinct super-enhancer sites and controls Lrrc32 expression in a prominent autoimmune and allergic disease risk locus

finding: The SNP rs33950507 C>T in the gene HBB was linked to Beta-thalassemia, which had a carrier frequency of 4% (1 in 25) in the Vietnamese population, representing a 12-fold increase in allele frequency compared to the East Asia population.
title: Genetic landscape of recessive diseases in the Vietnamese population from large-scale clinical exome sequencing

finding: The association of the FADS2 rs3834458 gene polymorphism with nonalcoholic fatty liver disease and coronary artery disease was established in the Chinese Han population, suggesting a link between this SNP and metabolic disorders.
title: Identification of Key Genes and Underlying Mechanisms in Cystic Fibrosis and its Associated Complications Based on Bioinformatics Analysis of Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: The impact of the C224T polymorphism (rs17571) on chronic obstructive pulmonary disease was analyzed, revealing correlations with oxidative and inflammatory markers, indicating its role in disease pathogenesis.
title: Identification of Key Genes and Underlying Mechanisms in Cystic Fibrosis and its Associated Complications Based on Bioinformatics Analysis of Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: The FADS2 rs174575 (C/G) polymorphism was correlated with circulating lipid levels and susceptibility to type 2 diabetes mellitus, indicating a role in metabolic regulation.
title: Identification of Key Genes and Underlying Mechanisms in Cystic Fibrosis and its Associated Complications Based on Bioinformatics Analysis of Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: It was found to significantly decrease the expression of MRPL23 in multiple tissues, including the colon-transverse, oesophagus-muscularis, and stomach, with extremely low p-values suggesting its relevance.
title: Unveiling the role of Tdark genes in genetic diseases and phenotypes through bioinformatics-based functional enrichment and network analyses

finding: This SNP was reported to decrease RPUSD4 expression in the pancreas and showed association with diabetes, with relevant low p-values, stressing its potential impact on disease susceptibility.
title: Unveiling the role of Tdark genes in genetic diseases and phenotypes through bioinformatics-based functional enrichment and network analyses

finding: The SNP rs10767664 was identified as highly associated with obesity, showing a significant association (p=4.69×10^-26) in a cohort of 204,158 individuals. The A-allele was linked with anxious feelings and anxiety-like behavior, demonstrated through mouse models where deletion of the BE5.1 enhancer, carrying this polymorphism, led to increased anxiety-like behavior in female mice. It was also associated with increased food intake in the context of CHOW diet, although no significant weight gain was observed over 28 days, suggesting marginal effects only. GWAS analysis confirmed a significant association with anxious feelings in human populations. Notably, the A-allele did not significantly affect BDNF mRNA levels but did influence BDNF-AS expression.
title: An ancient polymorphic regulatory region within the BDNF gene associated with obesity modulates anxiety-like behaviour in mice and humans

finding: The SNP rs12273363 was associated with major depressive disorder (MDD) and influenced BDNF promoter activity by altering the effects of a conserved repressor region on BDNF promotors. This finding emphasized the potential of combining genetic association analysis with comparative genomics to understand the regulation of BDNF and its connection to conditions like obesity and anxiety.
title: An ancient polymorphic regulatory region within the BDNF gene associated with obesity modulates anxiety-like behaviour in mice and humans

finding: Identified as relevant for MHQ participation, with the allele linked to higher intelligence associated with more completions of the MHQ.
title: Genetic predictors of participation in optional components of UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs12252 was positively associated with severe influenza in hospitalized populations. It was proposed to express an N-terminal truncated isoform of IFITM3, which correlated with higher incidence of severe COVID-19. However, transcription of this truncated isoform was not detected in patient samples, indicating its association with disease severity.
title: Site-specific lipidation enhances IFITM3 membrane interactions and antiviral activity

finding: The SNP rs34481144 was associated with a loss-of-function allele in the IFITM3 gene's 5' untranslated region, leading to lower IFITM3 mRNA expression. This decrease in expression corresponded with a reduction in airway resident CD8+ T cells during viral infections, demonstrating its impact on immune response.
title: Site-specific lipidation enhances IFITM3 membrane interactions and antiviral activity

finding: The rs3025058 polymorphism in the matrix metalloproteinase-3 gene was linked to markers of atherosclerosis in type 2 diabetes mellitus patients, highlighting its relevance in cardiovascular health.
title: Identification of key genes and signaling pathway in the pathogenesis of Huntington’s disease via bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The variant rs4757652 was examined among LDHC eQTLs, revealing a series of variants exhibiting positive CxC genetic effects across multiple tissues, apart from the testis. The FastGxE analysis crystallized this genetic effect, emphasizing a tissue specificity in the testis that was previously obscured.
title: Fast and powerful statistical method for context-specific QTL mapping in multi-context genomic studies

finding: The novel SNP rs11220471 near ST3GAL4 was found to affect sE-selectin levels. It indicated a potential biological mechanism where variations may alter selectin ligands and impact recruitment of cells to inflamed endothelium.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies seven novel loci associating with circulating cytokines and cell adhesion molecules in Finns

finding: The SNP rs11030317 was linked to metabolic characteristics of tumor cells and residual disease in breast cancer. The study highlighted that the MRD cells exhibited metabolic profiles resembling those of tumor cells, indicating a persistent oncogenic memory. The findings related directly to the de-regulated glycolysis observed in specific cancer contexts, suggesting therapeutic targeting opportunities for tumor recurrence.
title: Oncogenic memory underlying minimal residual disease in breast cancer

finding: The SNP rs5002, located within the triplex target site of the Adrenomedullin (ADM) gene, was associated with various hematological parameters such as hemoglobin concentration, red blood cell count, and hematocrit levels. This indicated a potential role for rs5002 in influencing gene expression via triplex formation, which may have therapeutic implications.
title: HIF1α-AS1 is a DNA:DNA:RNA triplex-forming lncRNA interacting with the HUSH complex

finding: An association was found between the genetic polymorphism of SAA1 rs12218 and myocardial infarction, suggesting its potential role in MI susceptibility in a Chinese population.
title: Identification and Interaction Analysis of Molecular Markers in Myocardial Infarction by Integrated Bioinformatics Analysis

finding: The rs2168101 G>T polymorphism in the first intron of LMO1 was associated with an increased risk of developing neuroblastoma in children. Specifically, the G allele was linked to higher levels of LMO1 expression, leading to formation of the adrenergic core regulatory circuitry (CRC), which facilitates neuroblastoma tumor initiation. In contrast, the T allele resulted in lower LMO1 expression and was associated with a mesenchymal CRC, thus reducing neuroblastoma initiation rates. This genetic variation was shown to influence tumor development in a zebrafish model, which over 400 million years of evolution has retained similar genetic mechanisms as humans.
title: Genetic Predisposition to Neuroblastoma Results from a Regulatory Polymorphism that Promotes the Adrenergic Cell State

finding: The SNP rs2278749 within the ARNTL gene was documented for its potential association with Alzheimer's disease. Although it was not directly linked to sociability, its preceding connections to circadian disruptions and psychiatric disorders highlighted its relevance in the broader landscape of neuropsychiatric conditions.
title: Genetic underpinnings of sociability in the UK Biobank

finding: The analysis of SNP rs11020263 revealed a positive association with hypoxia-induced signatures in gastric cancer, specifically linked to myofibroblasts. This finding highlighted the genetic influence of tumor microenvironments and their impact on gene expression patterns in the context of cancer biochemistry.
title: Water as a reactant in the differential expression of proteins in cancer

finding: rs143883793, found in the TNKS1BP1 gene, was identified as a rare variant significantly associated with suicide death, also possessing a CADD PHRED score above 22, suggesting it is likely deleterious.
title: Rare protein coding variants implicate genes involved in risk of suicide death

finding: The SNP rs10835153 was identified as a regulatory candidate for LGR4, a gene implicated in Wnt signaling pathways relevant to bone remodeling and development.
title: Prioritization of osteoporosis-associated GWAS SNPs using epigenomics and transcriptomics

finding: The SNP rs12293670, located near the NRGN gene, was involved in a demonstration of the CRISPR Del/Rei method, which illustrated high editing efficiency in induced pluripotent stem cells (iPSCs). The study confirmed accurate editing through various steps, showcasing successful sequence confirmations and screening outcomes that emphasized the precision of the method applied to this particular SNP.
title: CRISPR Del/Rei: A simple, flexible, and efficient pipeline for scarless genome editing

finding: The SNP rs1491818 located in the lncRNA LINC02742 was also identified as being up-regulated in excitatory neurons in ALS patients compared to the PN neuronal population. This indicated a potential involvement of LINC02742 in the pathogenesis of ALS through its regulatory functions.
title: Transcriptional profiling of human brain cortex identifies novel lncRNA-mediated networks dysregulated in amyotrophic lateral sclerosis

finding: The SORL1*A528T SNP was indicated as a candidate variant likely involved in retromer function, with deficits in retromer-dependent endosomal recycling shown to be implicated as causal factors in Alzheimer's disease.
title: In vivo validation of late-onset Alzheimer’s disease genetic risk factors

finding: The SNP rs144215891 was determined to be a missense variant (c.1535A>G; p.Y512C) present at a frequency of 77/139948 in GnomAD and 71/120620 in ExAC. This variant was found in multiple patients, including those with PAM, and is suggested to enhance oxidative stress through the increased ROS production due to alterations in the NOX4 gene function.
title: Rare coding variants in NOX4 link high superoxide levels to psoriatic arthritis mutilans

finding: The SNP rs765662279 was observed as a missense variant (c.1105G>T; p.V369F), which had a frequency of 9/245174 in GnomAD and 4/121010 in ExAC. This variant was associated with altered enzyme activity, leading to increased levels of ROS in PAM patients and linking it to the disease mechanism.
title: Rare coding variants in NOX4 link high superoxide levels to psoriatic arthritis mutilans

finding: In the context of Alzheimer's disease (AD), the heterozygous presence of the rs2282649 SNP variant was identified in L150P hiPSC neurons. This SNP was associated with Golgi alterations that led to altered protein trafficking within the trans-Golgi network. Such changes likely contributed to the functional impairments observed in the Golgi's role in APP processing, which is pivotal in AD.
title: Golgi fragmentation - One of the earliest organelle phenotypes in Alzheimer’s disease neurons

finding: The rs2070045 SNP variant was detected as a homozygous form in L150P hiPSC neurons. This finding correlated with significant functional alterations in the Golgi apparatus, influencing protein handling mechanisms essential for neuronal health and, consequently, the pathophysiology of AD. The homozygosity for this SNP indicated an increased risk linked to AD pathology.
title: Golgi fragmentation - One of the earliest organelle phenotypes in Alzheimer’s disease neurons

finding: The missense mutation rs4988321 in the LRP5 gene had previously been associated with BMD in various studies, indicating its importance despite not being significantly associated with eBMD in this particular analysis.
title: Transcriptome-wide Association Study and eQTL colocalization identify potentially causal genes responsible for bone mineral density GWAS associations

finding: The variant rs4057749 (c.532T>C, p.Cys178Arg) in the OR8B4 was associated with impairment in perceiving anisic aldehyde and muguet alcohol. This mutation affected a conserved cysteine residue crucial for a disulfide bridge in class A GPCRs, leading to a loss of function.
title: The mutational landscape of human olfactory G protein-coupled receptors

finding: The mutation rs4501959 (c.262G>A, p.Asp88Asn) in the OR52L1 potentially impaired the perception of carboxylic acids in sweat and certain components related to butter smell. This variant substituted a conserved residue involved in GPCR activation mechanisms.
title: The mutational landscape of human olfactory G protein-coupled receptors

finding: The rs12252-C allele was reported to produce an alternatively spliced transcript encoding an N-terminus truncated IFITM3. This variant has been associated with severe outcomes in influenza, HIV-1 infections, and COVID-19, indicating its significant role in immune response. Multiple studies confirmed these associations, highlighting the clinical relevance of this SNP.
title: Alternative splicing expands the antiviral IFITM repertoire in Chinese horseshoe bats

finding: The SNP rs2277311 within the NRXN2 gene showed association with serum urate levels and was predicted to have regulatory functions.
title: Genomic dissection of 43 serum urate-associated loci provides multiple insights into molecular mechanisms of urate control
